text: From tap. Hazy gold, foamy white head that quickly devolved to a thin collar. Light funk, wheat on the nose. Medium sour flavors, lemon, grass. Dry spritzy mouthfeel. Dry mostly grassy finish. Refreshing

Bottle sample. Tasted on the 12/05/2017 at MBCC (Copenhagen). Cloudy yellow colour with a thin smooth white head. Aroma of yeast, lemon and other citrics, grass and cereal. Taste is slightly sour and citric. Refreshing and easy to drink. Next one please!

Tap at Js. Pours a clearish gold with a finger of foam that lingers. Light pear and yeast nose. Soft carbonation, lemon and a lingering tartness on the finish. Smooth with a touch of limeade on the end. Quite nice.

Sampled on draft at Tapped this beer poured a murky dark yellow color with a medium sized creamy white head that left good lacing. The aroma was tart and citric with a bit of chalk, dry and funky with a hint of pineapple. The flavor was sweetish and tangy with tart lemon, mango and pineapple. Long finish. Medium body. Decent
Fad: Lysegul diset øl med et fint skumhoved. Duften er stald med lidt witbier noter, men mest stald. Frisk og sur er kendetegnene. Der er ikke meget witbier over den. Men rigtig lækker er den dog.

duft: frisk citrus lidt krydret 
smag frisk citrus lime svag krydret let drikkelig

Tap at MBCC 2017. Pours hazy pale golden. Funky, lemon, barnyard aroma. Tart. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Mbcc, blue session 
Cloudy golden color with a thin white head. 
Funky nose with some mild spices. 
Flavor has citrusy, apricotty notes. 
Nice easy, fruity good drinkability.

Draught @ MBCC 2017. Pours cloudy yellowish with a smooth head. Aroma of funky yeastiness, farmyard citrus. Taste is smooth, slightly tart and sourish with some funky yeastiness. Finish is sourish and funky with some tartness. Okay.
Tap at MBCC2017, Copenhagen. Color is cloudy golden with small white head. Aromas and flavors: Fruits, wheat and malts. Quite easy.

Tasty sour wit, tart and citric with a pleasant spiced backbone and a breezy, easygoing texture. Lemon and coriander are prominent, but mild, sweet wheat and grass give a bit of padding to the sourness, while a modest but noticeable funk lies underneath. Finish stays tart, oak and vanilla peeking through on the fade. Tart nose, yeasty and dry, nice for the style. Pours not too pretty, but the feels right, sparkly and bright. Overall a highly drinkable wit. Nice.

Bottle
Aroma-coriander, orange
Appearance-pale, hazy, minimal head, 
Taste-medium sourness, lightly bitter, light sweetness, 
Palate-light body, thin feel, lively, sour finish, 
Overall-very refreshing
12.7 oz. bottle. Pour was hazy golden, white head. Aroma of citrus, orange, lemon. Taste was tart, sour, lemon, wheat, spice.
Bottle at BBF. Golden colour without head. tart and fruity aroma. Sour, fruity, acidic taste. Medium body.

Bottle. Hazy golden color. Yeast sediment in the bottom. Large white foamy head response. Aroma is quite tart, coriander, orange peel. Wheat grains. Belgian wit character comes through a lot in the flavor. Coriander, orange zest, wheat, with a sourness that comes through on the finish with a cheek tingle. Medium-light body. Sour tingle over the palate. Nice.
Fresh, dry, light-medium sourness with wonderful funk. Coriander, oranges, apples, rotten fruit.

Got this one at Winooski Beverage Warehouse over the holidays.

Poured from a 12oz. bottle.

Appearance: Light, pale-yellow body, good-sized head with lots of tiny bubbles.

Smell: Citrus-like aroma.

Taste: Very active carbonation, lemon-like character. Taste fades fast though.

Mouthfeel: Light-bodied in the palate, reminds me of lemon & ginger.

Drinkability: Very drinkable, light brew. Probably better served in warmer weather. I wouldnt rush to get one, but id have another.

Reviewed on: 02-01-2008

Slightly hazy light golden under a thin white ring of foam. Lovely tart wild yeast nose with gentle lime zest and orange peel and a kiss of german wheaty sourness like a Berliner. Crisp dry and gently tart flavor thats wheaty and gently lemony...like a not-so-sour Berliner weisse. Very smooth and gently tart and super bright and pleasant.
Clear golden beer with a thin white head. Smells woody, sour, and a slight bit of syrup. Taste is delicate and funky, tasrt. A bit of a citrus pell type taste. Nice but restrained. Aroma has toffee.

Keg at Brewdog as Jolly Pumpkin Calabaza Blanca, 4.8%. Hazy golden yellow, translucent, lightly sparkling, foamy white head. Aroma is funky, lemony. Body is smooth with soft carbonation. Taste is lightly buttery, oaky, grapefruit, lemon sherbet, more oak. Really good. I would happily drink lots of this and wish I had a bit more in front of me.
Bottle in Brewdog Shoreditch. Pours golden and hazy with no head. Nose of lemon and wheat. Taste is quite sour at first with some herbs and bret. Has a very clean finish.

Bottle at 4:20 in Rome-Italy, batch 318/319. Cloudy light golden pour, tick and super white foam. Nose: white wine, wood, grapes, wheat. Mouth: frizzy carbo, soft texture, pepper overall, dry. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Keg at Brewdog Aberdeen. Pours cloudy, yellowy-gold. Lots of citrus sherbet on the nose with orange peel. Taste of bitter lemon, herbs, dry cider and peach. This has a sharp and dry feel with some sherbet funk and oily finish. The sharp flavours dominate. Orange and herbs with a real fizzy kick. If I was blindfolded, Id guess I was drinking a weird, dry cider.

Bottle. Pours hazy/clody yellow with nice white head, stays. Aroma: sourish,hay, cow shit, oranges, fresh tobacco leaf, ash, Taste: medium sour, wheat, pale berries, orange, juicy, malty, apple peal. Thin plus body. If thats a Witbier then ...
Sourish.smooth.juicy finiosh. Nice summertime drink.

Jolly Pumpkin Calabaza Blanca
Keg at BD Shoreditch, 23/01/16.
Light hazed on a golden orange pour topped with a decent off white covering.
Nose is oak, papaya, spice, white grape, melon, faint citric piss tang.
Taste comprises peach, mellow tropical fruits, spice, orange peel, floral notes, light herbal elements.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close with a sweet fruit lilt mellowed by faded wood.
Solid for the style.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Pours orange, hazy, thin head. Big tangerine aroma, not much else. Its really tart. Loads of acid and citrus, a bit of yeast in the back. Not my thing but a well made example. Might taste better on a sultry summer afternoon.
Light spice and banana yeast aroma. A refreshingly light mouthfeel , with a slight spice finish .
Tap @ Fermentoren, Aarhus. Pale bright yellow with a fluffy head. Notes of citrus, estery, sweet, light floral and grainy.

Keg at Brewdog Birmingham. Pours hazy golden with a thin laced head. Aroma is funky, some cloves and orange peel. Taste is a little funky sourness but tempered with orange and spices. Really dry but refreshing at the same time. Nice
37,5 cl.bottle. Hazy golden colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of yeast, spice, fruit, coriander, citrus and wheat.

From tap at Fermentoren Aarhus. Pours a hazy golden yellow with a medium sized, white head. Aroma has peely citrus, peaches, stone fruits, sweet spices, clove and esters, funk. Taste is sour, tart, crisp, lactic, light vinegar, fresh juicy "golden ale"-style finish. Pretty spicy and crisp. Light body and a rather high carbonation.

Draught @ Fermentoren, Aarhus. Pours slightly hazy dark yellow with a white head. Aroma of wheat, yeast, light bretty, little sour, light spice, sweet fruit, oranges. Flavor is light sour, wheat, yeasy, light spice, tart fruity, orangepeel. Thin to medium body, average carbonation, light acidic finish. 080116
Tap.Clear colour with medium head.Aroma is heavy sour with dry mouthfeels fresh with hint of flowers and citrus nice and strange overall but good.

Pours a hazy pale golden straw color with a finger of white foam. The nose is a mix of rustic fieldgrass, slight musty low tide, hint of spice and citrus. Palate follows with light foggy flavors. A bit subdued and watery but still a nice crushable tart session beer.

12oz bottle via Beer Gonzo. It pours a clean pale golden color with a medium white head. Aroma is tangy acidic lemon peel, light jammy stone fruit, grassy peppery straw. Taste is also mostly tart and acidic with notes of lemon peel, gooseberries, grass, straw, lemon juice. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, nicely tart and refreshing
A bottle on Black Christmas 2016 at 12 Kings. Pours a cloudy blonde with a white head. Aroma is sour, malty, some spices. Taste is the same with low bitterness. Meh.
Pours clear light yellow, skunky aroma with mild carbonation. Sour underripe apricot notes. Overall an easy to drink beer but lacks a good punch.

Bouteille achetée à La Mise En Bière - De couleur jaune pale trouble avec une mousse blanche crémeuse et abondante qui colle bien au verre - Au nez des arômes vineux, raisin, pomme, cidre presque vinaigre, épicé, blé, chêne, floral,cest complexe et on sait que ca sera acide - En bouche cest acide, on sent bien le fût, chêne, cidré, vineux, raisin, floral, frais - Corp léger/moyen, amertume légère, carbonation pétillante, frais et acide, final raisin et acide - Moin acide que le nez le présageait, fraiche, très particulière mais vraiment bien réalisée

Aroma is funk, barnyard, spices, tart, citrus, great. Appearance is pale golden, hazy, white head. Taste is tart, funky, barnyard, citrus, dry, wheat, fantastic. Mouthfeel is medium body, light crisp carbonation, tart wheat spice aftertaste. Overall, this is a Wit? Fantastic. Like a great Farmhouse.

Pours hazy golden yellow with low white head. Aroma of wheat, light honey, coriander, lemongrass, mild funk. Taste is light, crisp tart with a sweet finish. Light and smooth body with soft carbonation.

Pours milky yellow with minimal head 
Aromas tart of green apples, lemons, grapes, fruit juice 
Taste has tart notes of grapes, over ripe apples, citrus, hints of coriander 
More sour wild than witbier but highly refreshing
That may be the most accurate label description Ive ever seen. Orange peel and coriander, refreshingly tart, wonderfully dry finish. Nailed it.

UPDATED: SEP 18, 2016 From bottle, the pour is slightly cloudy and is pale yellow in color with a thin head that dissipates. The aroma is sour and lemon. The taste is bitter lemon, cilantro, and coriander.  As I continue drinking this, the orange peel becomes more prevalent.  The mouthfeel is thin and the finish is Herbal, sour and strong lemon.

Bottle, 0.375l. Hazy pale golden color with thin quickly diminishing white head and average sparkling appearance. Aroma is funky, yeasty, vinous, grainy, citric and with notes of coriander. Taste starts light sweet grainy, bready and funky, follows by refreshing tart citrus, yeast and white wine, mouthfeel is crisp and dry, while finish is mild bitter. Light body, thin texture and average carbonation in palate. Nonaggressive funky witbier...

Tap at Jolly Pumpkin Detroit. Hazy light golden with white head. Light sour grains and lemon, light spices and grass, dry wheat dough. Under medium sour and light bitter. Under medium bodied with soft fizzy carbonation. Very refreshing!

On tap. Pours pale yellow with foamy white head. Some lacing. Aroma is of citrus, coriander, white wine. Taste features a strong and pleasant acidity, wheat, white wine, and oak. Refreshing to the max. Over average Witbier
Disig gyllengul öl med vitt skum. Doften är lätt citronsyrlig med jäst och hö. I smaken tillkommer en lättare kryddighet.

Im sure the first time I found beer to be truly enjoyable was when I was drinking a white ale in the summer. Im glad to say that enjoyment has never changed despite all the great things Ive gotten to try. Calabaza Blanca is an extremely classy Wit and a phenomenal summer choice. It pours light yellow with pillowy head. Fruit peel, spice, yeast, and bread aromas. Both the flavor and consistency are creamy. Lots of sweetness in this brew, but its balanced by a light tartness in the finish. Go figure, an excellent yeast-focused brew from Jolly Pumpkin.

Bottle.

A- Lemon, wheat, soft.

A- Yellow color, cloudy liquid, white head.

T- Lemon, wheat, citrus, milky, egg, subtle spice.

P- Light body, creamy texture, average carbonation, soft finish.

O- Not really a typical wit in my opinion, but good. Very light and not a lot of flavor. I expected it to be sour or funky but it was not.

Cloudy / hazy golden pour with thick, disappearing foam. Moderately spicy nose -- coriander and orange, with a touch of pepper. The pepper and citrus persists in the taste with a moderate tartness at the end. It is a good wheat beer with a slightly surprising and pleasant tartness and dry finish. Reminiscent of their Uber Wit, but less aggressive.

Draft at Bru Craft. Hazy pale yellow pout with fizzy soft white foam that left a lasting ring but no lace. Bright citrus florals with just a hint of straw. Modestly tart. Lemon shortbread. Clementine marmalade. Grape leaves. Loquats. Oyster crackers. Thirst quenching.

Very murky bright sandy yellow, very thin bubbly head. Nose is a rich sweaty zest, a bit burnt plastic and soft earthiness. Initial taste is a rich vibrant tartness, stoney fruit and veg. Carbonation is sleek and mouthfeel is gritty. Finishes a fair power of grapefruit and pineapplely with lingers of more rich tartness. What is Wit. Bottle, Beermoth.

Bottle [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Wine, Edinburgh - golden orange pour with white head. Aroma and taste has prominent citrus orange fruit, medium sour, some grassy and floral nuance into the finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Clear pale golden. Nose is spices, lemon, funky, tart apples. Taste is tart and bitter, lemon, herbs, cloves, spices. I liked the nose more than the taste and palate.
From bottle. Pours hazy lemon gold. Nose of citrus fruit, apricot. Tart and refreshing to taste.

Bottle thanks to McNeillR.
Appearance - looks like a wit. Pale yellow, thin head.
Nose - definitely sour. Wood and sour apples. 
Taste - more of the same.
Palate - light to medium bodied with a tangy texture and a long dry finish.
Overall - not a wit more of a sour. Good beer.
Bottle at appellation. Pours pale golden, nose is huge funk, citrus, yeasty, taste is similar, dry funk.
Bottle at Comely Bankers II. Pours hazy yellow with a thin white head. Aromas of light farmhouse funk. Taste is light sour, apple, paracetamol. Dry, crisp finish.
The witbiers orange-citrus character and lemony tart, sour character really works well together. Nice.

Bottle into a glass. Super hazy hay pour. Aroma of spice, funk, horse blanket, earth, pepper, apples. Taste is tart apples, spice, funk, fruity esters, white bread. Slight tartness. Crisp and refreshing, easy drinking but complex.
Pours a cloudy golden yellow with fizzy head. Aromas of citrus peel, yeast, hay, and some coriander. Flavors of coriander, a little vegatal, and some nice barrel. Tart beautiful wit.

UPDATED: NOV 22, 2015 A hazy golden pour without much foam. The aroma is spicy, citrusy, with some slight lacto funk. Some sea buckthorn and anonymous berries. Some orange zest, too. The mouthfeel is silky, punctuated by needly but agreeable carbonation. The taste leans tart, with residual fruity sweetness. Flavors of berries, cola, and a hint of brown sugar smooth out the acidity and are finished off by some mild, mineraly astringency for a dry finish. Deliciously fruity, mildly herbal (coriander) aftertaste. Refreshing. Not sure this is what a Witbier should scrictly speaking taste like -- but in the summer that discussion would be purely academic.

Crazy interesting aroma with lots of the spice standing out and firm funkiness, think barnyard and maybe a hint of lacto. Drinks really nice and is super dry with a quenching tartness. I enjoyed the spice in this beer more than most in this style category. Good beer especially for those who like sour but not over the top sour.

Damn Great wit. Hazy light golden color with big fluffy head. Aroma of wheat clove fennel and more. Taste of the same with some grapefruit and sour wine. The cloves continue throughout to balance the mild tartness. Light grains stick around to the dry finish.

Bottle from the LCBO. Pours a super active clear golden colour, head is white and wont stop pouring out of the bottle, reminds me of Orval. Head dies down to a thin layer, leaving some clumpy lacing behind. Nose is fruity, distinctly Belgian like. Tastes, sweet, a bit tart. Really tasty.
Hazy straw/gold color; Medium body; Aroma of yeast, floral, citrus, & coriander; Flavor of wheat, yeast, citrus, some hops, and spice; Dry finish; Fairly decent.
Tart and dry wit. No detected oak , but plenty of orange and coriander. Hazy appearance. On tap.

Shared bottle in Atlanta. 
A very funky witbier, although Id classify this as a sour white ale. 
Moderately tart and rather lemony. 
Some vinegar in the somewhat medicinal aroma.

Bottle from European Summer Santa, many thanks Santa SlackerMads
. Hazy orange yellow color with small white head. Aroma of wheat, oranges, coriander, barnyard. Tart taste with wheat, spices, oranges, orange zest, lemon, pineapples, salt. Tasty, refreshing beer.

Draught @ Jolly Pumpkin Ann Arbor. Cloudy dark yellow with very small frothy ring, coriander aroma, medium carbonation, slightly sour, orange peel flavor, medium tart finish. Very smooth and easy to drink.

Bottle at home. Hazy yellow, headless. Complex aroma of sour melons, funk, orange creamsicle, wheat, oak, and a faint Brett - like yeasty smell with hints of leather and rubber. Very light and spritzy body, with a creamy wheat texture. Sour and tart, fruity, earthy, funky, with fresh melon flavors, more Bretty notes, and a surprisingly clean, tart, dry finish. Outstanding.

750ml bottle @Unknown cellar, Riga, thanks. Clear pale yellow color. Fruity, citrus, malty and grainy aroma. Fizzy aroma! Sour and malty base which is flavored with some graininess and citrus. I think its off or going off very soon. It tastes old and more acidic sour than it should be. Need to have one fresh.

Looks opaque yellow (the first thing I thought when I poured it was "lemon sherbet"), quick very white head, no lace. Light citrus and wheat on the nose. Tart and bittersweet. Middle is a garden of sour citrus with hints of coriander and verbena. Finish is dry, sour, and brisk. Yum.
Excellent lightly tart witbier, similar to the Anchorage version of the style. Great stuff.

750 mL from Mile High. This is a very cloudy and light beer with a quickly diminishing white head. The aroma is fantastic, as I would expect from Jolly Pumpkin. Its pleasantly tart with barnyard funk and sour fruits. Light orange and coriander come through along with wheat and pepper. The palate is light and spritzy, but still has a decent body on account of the wheat. The flavor is complex, refreshing and excellently executed. Its got a perfect level of tartness to accompany the citrus and spice profile. The finish brings vinous suggestions. This is another top notch offering from JP.

Backlog. 375 ml bottle shared, purchased at The Proper Pour I think. Orange and pretty clear appearance with a fully dissipating head. Aroma of sour notes, orange peel, coriander and wheat malts. Similar flavor, tart, zesty and herbal with a light sour and dry finish. Refreshing and pretty fun to drink.

Tap at Bierkeller. Cloudy yellow pour with almost no head. Aroma is mostly coriander and orange peel. Some grains and flowers too. Very light sourness and tartness in the taste. Really just coriander and oranges for flavor. Maybe some lemon juice too. Solid witbier but this is one of my least favorite styles.

Aroma is metallic. Iron. Honey. White wine. 

Looks really nice. Hazy pale lighter yellow. 

Taste is on point. Just sour enough. Tart. Flavors are subtle and balanced. Oak is there on the finish but not a big player. 

Palate is smooth. A little yeasty on the finish. Somewhat dry. Medium body. 

Overall this is a really good beer.
Tap at Sunset. Wheaty, bit creamy, light sourness, bit of citrus. Vinous and berries. Bit of yoghurt. Interesting.

Draft at Fermentoren.
Pale yellow, white head.
Satsumas and citrus aroma.
Slightly sour, caramel and citrus finish, slightly bitter
Poured a hazy medium amber with an off white head. Aroma of sweet fruit and lactose. Light body, flavour is medium sweet, lightly spicy.

Poured from a 12 OZ bottle into a pint glass.
Aroma- big citrus aroma
Appearance- Pours a golden color with a large white head
Taste- Has a tart citrus flavor
Palate- A medium bodied beer with moderate to high carbonation
Overall- a real good example of a Witbier, highly recommended.
Tap @ Fermentoren, KBH. Pours hazy yellow with a white head. Funk, straw, Brett and grass. Its dry and hoppy. Mild Lemon and citrus. Lovely! Best witbier Ive had since the last J.P Wit.

On tap at Fermentoren. Cloudy pale yellow, almost with a green hue, and a lasting white head. The aroma is funky and fruity with a spicy touch. Dry and tart flavour with funk, pineapple, orange and a spiced and salty touch. Gose in disguise?
Old rating. A nice wheat beer. Citrus, spices, clove, oak, slightly sour wheat. Crisp and drinkable.

Amarelada, turva, espuma branca abundante, duradoura. Aroma de especiarias, champagne, vinho branco, carbonação alta, corpo leve. Levemente salgada e ácida. Aftertaste cítrico, leve. Uma cerveja "curiosa", mas não agradou muito.

Hazy gold. Nice tart funk with leather and light spice and citrus. Flavor is light tart citrus and mild leather that fades to sweet white wheat, vanilla, and faint oak. Lingering tart citrus and wheat. Real nice.

Comparing this one to Hitachino White (HW), which I had just a few days ago. Aroma: Calabaza Blanca (CB) starts out with a more yeast-forward aroma- lots of sweet gum and also a healthy dash of coriander. Theres an orange peel presence that is not negligible. Appearance: Slightly cloudy pale yellow with a frothy white head that sticks around. Flavor: Mostly matches the nose; gum and coriander spiciness up front; orange peel becomes more apparent toward the finish, which dries up a bit. Palate: Full body, sticky texture, lively carbonation, long finish. Overall: Really the other end of the spectrum from HW; whereas that beer is more lemony tart yet wheat forward, this beer comparably is much more yeast and spice centric. HW finishes pleasantly dry, while CB has a lingering sweetness. Id take HW every time. Had both beers on tap (one at Gralehaus, one at Louisville Beer Store).

Very hazy light orange pour with a bit of stark white head, very bubbly. Pert fruity scent of clementines, lemon, citrus zest, white pepper, apple and pear, rubbery belgian yeast, light wheat, a funky/sour minute maid fruit punch aroma overall. Soft carbonation, bubbly light mouthfeel, dry finish. Sour taste, lots of citrus zest, pepper, wheat, some sour yeast. Really great sour wheat.

UPDATED: MAR 30, 2016 bottle at World of Beer Katy. Very nice and an interesting twist. Slightly hazy pale golden colored with a frothy white head. Medium bodied, softly carbonated and quite dry. Taste is spicy, woody, slightly bitter, fruity and yeasty sweet and tart. Aroma full of spices, oak, yeast, and orange.

Pours a cloudy pale yellow with a massive(kinda excessive) rocky white head and big globs of lace. Aroma is spicy, coriander, zesty citrus, and some bready wheat notes. Flavour is zesty lemon, orange peel, spicy, coriander, light honey like notes, bready wheat and lightly tart.

Pours a hazy yellowish gold with a huge frothy white head. Aroma of oranges, citrus peel, coriander, wheat and floral esthers. Taste is citrus peel, oranges, coriander, spicy wheat and a nice complimenting dry finish with a touch of sourness.

The beer pours a slightly hazy yellow color with a medium white head that fades quickly. The aroma blends wheat, coriander, Belgian yeast, and a hint of citrus, and the taste is quite sour and mildly sweet; however, the sourness fades quickly, leaving a really pleasant, light citrus and yeast flavor. The palate fuses a medium-light body, slick texture, and an average carbonation.
its Jolly Pumpkin beer. is there really anything else that needs to be explained?

Bottle. Pours hazy pale straw with a medium sized fluffy white head. Good retention and lace. Nose is lemony citrus and Belgian wit yeast. Not overly complex. Flavor is light tart and crisp. Light body, heavy carbonation, thin oily texture and a dry tart finish.

Bottled on January 21st 2014, slightly over a year ago. This one has "Saison" written all over it. Murky light yellow colouring with considerable carbonation. Im going to ding it, because the gentlest of pours erupts into an overflowing massive white head dominating two thirds of the glass.
On the nose it is all pepper and cinnamon. Very spicy.
Tastes are more of the same. It has that light but flavourful thing going for it, that the best Saisons have (even if not officially categorized as a Saison).
Id buy this one again, but would drink it on a hot summer day.

Bottle. Hazy hay yellow liquid with medium white head. Aroma of lemon peel, light grain, white pepper, light spices and light earth. Taste is dry, light bitter and light sour with notes of lemon peel, light grain and light apples. Light to medium bodied with medium to hugh carbonation. Really nice and dry.

Aroma -- apple, pineapple, citrus aroma.

Appearance -- light, golden yellow hue w/ significant head-retention.

Taste -- tastes like this was brewed w/ apple skins, pineapple, and other citrus. Sessionable and moderately sour.

Palate -- semi-sour mouthfeel; overall rather light and underwhelming.
user_location: The Garden of the Beer Gods, North Carolina, USA

text: Bottle sample at tasting at Beer & Beyond, Tel Aviv. Hazy light yellow with small white head. Aroma of wheat, banana, orange, coriander, some spiciness, funky and a bit yeasty. Nice sourness in the flavor, orange, banana, wheat, spicy, black pepper, lavender, dry sweet-sour finish. Medium carbonation, medium-bodied. Very good and refreshing.

Flaske fra esp0r. Lys gylden farge, klar, moderat karbonert med hvit skumtopp. Smaker sitrus, appelsinskall, koriander og krydder.
 Rett og slett en fornøyelig wit
1 pt 9.4 oz bottle. Pours a hazy golden colour with huge white head. Aroma is wheat, fruits, some spices and coriander. Taste is wheat, orange. Nice finish.

Bottle: Hazy golden body with a puffy, cloudy white head. Volatile, long-lasting, modest lacing left behind. Ive had many batches of this. Some are more tart, others are more funky. But they all have a nice bit of soured wheat on the nose, apple skin, mineral water, stone fruits, & a mild lemon rind accent with a touch of spiced yeast & coriander wafting into the finish. Certainly bottles have a huge corky & musky barnyard floor funk. Love those bottles. Flavor is crisp with lemon, green apple, light acidity, must, & a nice bit of dry wood in the aftertaste. Again, certain bottles have been more funky with a strong moldy cork & even a mild cheese rind presence. Either way, all bottles are quite nice. Crisp mouth feel, a touch watery & soft. Really nice beer.
pours hazy pale lime juice color. floral aroma with notes of sour lime, sour cranberry, sour apple and peach. taste is tart but juicy with lots of lime, and coriander. finish is medium. quite lovely.

Doux arômes de levures sauvages et dorange. Très grosse effervescence. La sensation en bouche est intense mais brève. Très sour avec traces de coriandre et dagrumes. Le vieillissement en barrique de chêne est plutôt absent au gout. Aucune amertume. Très rafraichissante.

750 ml Bottle. Hazy gold-straw yellow pour with a huge white that sticks around forever and leaves oh so much lace. Aroma of citrus, yeast and a bit of funk. Light wheat body, fairly effervescent carbonation. Taste of lemon, citrus, apple, orange, coriander, yeast, spice and again a bit of funk. Excellent.

Bottle to glass. Pours a mostly clear golden yellow light orange color with a big fizzy white head. Aroma is moderately tart, dry, oak, belgian wit spice, touch of orange zest. Flavor is a dry mild tart with a definite wit base. Tart fades extremely fast into a dry spicy finish. Decent, very drinkable, but Jolly Pumpkin definitely has some better options.
Hazy straw pour with a white head. Tart citrus aroma with light spice and dough. Taste is lemon, orange peel, wheat, light spice and funk. Light dry palate. Nice beer.

(750ml bottle from the LCBO) Pours hazy straw gold with a big bubbly white head that fades reasonably quickly for its size leaving lace. Aroma has sour apples, herbs, touch of tart citrus, a bit of dusty yeast, light-moderate Brett funk, a little acidic. On the palate, quite tart but not as sour as the nose suggests. Some apple, lemon and orange peel, a bit dusty and almost mineral with a bit of yeast. Slightly woody and dry and bitter in to the finish and lingering after, quite herbal and floral, and lightly spicy. A tartness lingers around the corner of the mouth and citrus peels persist a bit til the end. Bit of stone in the aftertaste. Light body with a fairly aggressive carb of big, effervescent bubbles. Definitely not your run of the mill wit, twisted a bit with the JB lightly sour/tart/funky/woody character. A little light as their beers seem to be. Would make a nice table beer on a hot summer afternoon I think, but maybe slightly underpowered as a pure sipper.

Pours hazy pale straw with an explosive three fingers of rocky white head great retention, moderate lacing (4/5) Nose is Belgian funk, citrus peel, coriander, wheat, green apple. (9/10) Taste is moderate sweet, moderately strong tart. (9/10) Light body, prickly carbonation, dry tart finish. (4/5)

When I say explosive head, I mean it. Straight out of the cellar, no agitation at all, gently opened and immediately overflowed. Have a bucket ready. Sustained carbonation, tartness, and apple tones in the finish invite obvious cider comparisons. Unlike any witbier Ive ever had: only the mildest of wheat flavour fades in comparison to the barnyard funk and green apple tartness. After struggling for a bit for comparisons, Ill amend my comment: unlike pretty much any other beer Ive ever had - though the De Ranke XX Bitter or Cuvée de Ranke might be close. If anything, its more like a light, sour saison. Id like to vertical this new and following a years cellaring, to see how much of the funk and carbonation is due to ageing, and what its like new. Really good. (18/20)
Pours the colour of cloudy piss with the most abundant white head Ive ever seen. Mild aroma of orange and vinegar. Tastes of orange, coriander and vinegar. Not the best wit Ive ever had.
Quite a unique one, pleasantly melts in your mouth like wheat champagne, nice lemony touch, some tart, hints of spice, dry finish. Love it or hate it, this is nothing like any other witbier.
Pours an hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma of brett, peach, and lemon with some spices. Flavor is wheaty and acidic, some lemon and grain.

Bottle with Bruce at three philosophers. Pours a slightly hazy golden yellow with a huge white foamy head. Aroma is apples, lemons, yeast, and some sourness. Flavor has lots of apples, some wheat, yeastiness, and lemongrass. A bit cidery, but really nice. Somewhat tart and sour. Really nice beer.

Bière à la mousse blanche intense, nourrie par une furieuse carbonatation ; le liquide lui-même ressemble à de lor translucide, avec juste assez de nuageux pour ne pas être totalement translucide. Le nez est acidulé, rappelle les levures saison, avec des fruits jaunes pour agrémenter. Une bouche mince, un liquide tranchant, un peu sauvage sur les bords (volontaire ou non, ça cadre dans le paysage). Sans cette mousse hors de contrôle, on aurait ici un superbe hybride wit/saison boisé, mais on se contente en fin de compte de la trouver délicieuse et dune extraordinaire buvabilité.

Aug. 13, 2014. Bottle from LCBO. Lightly cloudy golden yellow. Very lively beer, large foamy white head. Sour grapes and apples in aroma. Dry white wine, sour grapes, apples in flavour. Crisp, tart, touch of sourness. Lovely.

Pours an opaque gold colour with a huge lasting foamy white head. Champagne like Carbonation is visible through the glass. 
Aroma of oranges
Taste: Sour orange with a coriander finish. High carbonation.
Huge over-frothed head from bottle pour. Aroma has some fruit, soap and chewing gum. Taste is light bodied with a bit of spice in the middle and a wine like finish.

The beer is a pale yellow color. Fairly hazy. Smallish white head. Fades away fairly quickly. The aroma is wheaty sweetness with lemony sourness and oak. Mild spicing. Some orange knocking around but it gets mixed up with the lemony sourness of the beer. Mild vanilla and other sweet woodiness. Theres some spicy wheat flavor up front. Lots of gentle lemon peel sourness. It really tastes more like a light, bright sour than a witbier. JP funkiness throughout. Lots of depth. Earthy and fruity background. The finish features a dry oak flavor and more of the spicing than showed up in the aroma. The coriander still seems pretty reserved but the orange peel makes its presence felt. Just gentle waves of lemon on top of a dried out wheat blanket. Pucker is mild but still more than youll find in any witbier. Relatively low carbonation. Its a wonderful beer but hard to compare to the style. In my mind, its more of a low intensity sour. It would be interesting to try this beer blended into a normal wit.

Super cloudy golden pour with monumental amounts of white head that sticks around. I get a bunch of lacto on the nose with nice spice and wood elements and a lemony note. Pretty dry in the mouth with the lemon coming through a lot more, spice and wood notes as well. The lactic note thats all over the nose is much less present. Finishes slightly tart.
Aroma is wheat, spices/a hint of heat and slightly musty. The flavor is wheat, fruit, slight sweetness and a long and very tart/bordering on lamibic sourness.

750ml from the lcbo. 
Cloudy oranger pour, huge, gushy, hard to pour white head. The aroma is pleasantly tart with some green, acidic hops and yeast notes.
The carb is a tad subdued to what i was expecting and the mouth feel is fibe. The finish is quite fruity, lots of orange, and lemon with some citrus zest from the green hops. The malted wheat really comes through in the finish. Medium to low bitterness, a superbly easy drinking beer. The tartness is very welcome to a normally boring style.

12.7 oz bottle. Pours a pale, straw yellow, hazy with an insanely large, rocky white head, matching retention and very nice lacing. Nose is fruity barnyard funk, grassy, daffodils, white pepper, chardonnay. Mouth is medium bodied, light creaminess, dry and pleasantly tart with hints of spices, citrus, lemongrass, bread dough and oaky wine barrel. Very nice.

To call this one foamy is an understatement. Slightly hazy golden colour. I find the aroma sort of mute and quiet, with light esters, some spice and nutmeg like quality and some citrus. On the palate it is light tasting, sporting some zesty citrus character and some sweet tang like flavour as well as those yeasty and wheaty notes. Decent stuff but not sure if it is one of the better representations ive had from this style.

A cloudy straw gold with a big soapy looking white head. A slow gusher. Yeasty spicy clove aroma with light banana. The beer has a medium body with a bit of viscous mouthfeel. Tangy wheat, wine like with light witbier notes. I was expecting more.

750ml bottle. Cloudy golden yellow with a huge frothy white head. Flavors are coriander, lemon peel, lemon juice, oak hay and funk with herbal and cheesy notes. Dry finish, nice lemony tartness. Light body, lively carbonation, slick texture.

On tap at Lunar Brewing Co., and snifter served, showing a hazed, orangey gold color, with frothy persistence to the soft white head, and curtainy cling to the lacing. The nose was an expressive but smooth presentation of floral notes, coriander, orange zest, and a hint of bubblegum. Light bodied, the taste was dry & tart, but offered a spritzy, seltzery effervescence that was almost a bit too lively, as it interrupted my enjoyment with some necessary burping. Otherwise, quite tasty & refreshing.

750 mL bottle. Gushed upon opening. Settles down eventually. Almost impossible to pour. Hazy gold with a huge, fluffy, white head. The aroma isnt too far off the norm. Maybe more herbal. Smells like Coke would smell if Coke were golden instead of brown. If that makes sense. The flavour is a little further from the middle of the road. Quite tart.

750 mL bottle from the LCBO, served in a stem glass. Pours cloudy straw-golden with a large white head that remains and leaves a small amount of fine lace. The nose has big notes of coriander, orange peel, tart citrus, wheat, oak and a touch of Brett. The flavour is surprisingly dry throughout with a subtle tart fruitiness, wheat, coriander, orange peel, green apple, oak and Brett notes. The finish is long and dry with tart fruity notes. On the palate it is light-medium in body with a dryish texture and intense carbonation. Overall, a very nice witbier with elegant Brett notes. It is a fair bit drier than I would have expected, but also nicely tart. A nice refreshing summer brew. 2014-08-06

Bottle from Percys.
This was poured into a mug.
The appearance was a decent glossed over yellow color with a one finger white foamy head that dissipated within less than thirty seconds.
The lacing was somewhat there and just kind of went all over.
The smell was tart and had some light orange and orange peel, light coriander, light lemon and ends with just a tad of yeastiness.
The taste was sweet and yeasty with a decent bitter to tart conglomeration of the lemon and orange peel.
On the palate, this one sat about a light to medium in body with a fair carbonation to allow a decent sessionability about it.
Overall, good witbier Id probably have again.
Lys strågul farve med lyst skum. Lukt av sitrus, gjær og krydder. Smak av grapefrukt, sitrus, gjær og krydder. Melkebaren.
Fin duft av hvete, sitron og høy. Dunkel gul farge. Tykt hvitt skum. Frisk syrlig smak av citron og noe hvete. godt.

Jaune paille, un peu voilée avec une mousse assez timide au départ, mais qui ne décolle jamais. Le nez est assez funky à cause des levures sauvages et très fruité (citrons, oranges). Le citron est à lhonneur en bouche, et est jumelé à des notes épicées bien évidentes. Lacidité franche de cette bière rend le tout très agréable à boire et la finale est assez sèche et presque saline. Délicieuse bière de soif.

This is a beauty! Pours clear straw with a massive gusher of head and lots of lacing. Nose is somewhat tart and orange peel. Flavours are orange peel, yeast, maybe some lemony tartness, lots of citrus fruit. Taste is light/medium sweet, light bitter and light tart, great balance. Medium body with lively carbonation and a pretty dry finish given all the tartness and fruit happening. A really great beer.

A Belgian white ale from a Michigan artisanal brewer. Calabaza Blanca is aged in large oak casks and refermented in the bottle. Spiced with orange peel and coriander, and utilizing wild yeast strains (Brett) its delivery is refreshingly tart and spicey with a wonderfully dry finish. This brewery produces some of the best bottle conditioned beers anywhere. All their beers are aged in oak barrels with wild yeasts giving a subtle, pleasant acidity not unlike tart fruits. After oak maturation these beers are, re-yeasted upon bottling allowing additional time to develop natural carbonation in the bottle and further enhance complex flavor refinement in the finished beer. Because of this you must learn to gently handle the opening and pouring of bottle conditioned beers  to avoid the foaming volcano effect. This white ale was particularly quenching

Great looking artistic label that reflect well the crafty brewery. OK, maybe I should of not tilted that bottle to get the good stuff at the bottom of the bottle. Complete volcano occurred with the heavy carbonation. Cloudy amber-yellow colour with a crazy foamy head, long retention and some soapy patches. Not expecting this big sourness, as thought this was a witbier. Lots of citrus with the lemon notes, and even some apples. The taste is still sour, but not as much. Craft brew yeast mostly with some mild fruits (previously mentioned). Crafty yes, but really not what I was expecting. Not one I would try again, especially for the price. Not sure if this is infected with this sourness that should not be in a witbier. Did I mention, not a fan ?

UPDATED: MAY 30, 2015 This beer is deeeeeeeeeee-lish, though I gotta tell you the initial head is a bit crazy. Ive had a Belgian Wit Brett before, but this one is excellent. Pour a cloudy yellow, with a huge level of white head which takes it time to settle to nothing, eventually. Some nice sour apple brett in the nose, little banana, not really getting the cilantro but thats okay. The taste is again, sour-apple brett, but not overpowering, nice wheat malts, overall great flavour. 

May 30, 2015
Had a bottle thats been in the cellar (aka sweet-ass dank basement) and if anything its better. Still foamy as hell, but nice socks and wit and barrel. Damn good.

Pours a hazy creamy light yellow, big big white head. Aroma of hay, funky Brett yeast, hard boiled egg, coriander, orange, dank basement must. Flavor is light and fruity wheat to start, gets funky & Brett.. Acidic on the back end. Easy breezy beautiful sour beer.

Cloudy pale yellow, quite a bit of white head. Super fresh citrus, sweaty socks. Pretty intensely sour, some hint of bitterness. Mild citrusy sweetness. Mid light body, very effervescent. Quite acidic. Pretty interesting and good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

750 mL bottle. Pours a hazy golden yellow with a suspicious quantity of pure white head. Orange, lemon, coriander, yeast spice and light mossy/funky brett tones on the nose, slightly woodsy/oaky as well. Champagne dry with some lacto sourness on the finish. Light bodied and very heavy on the carbonation. Delicious and complex but somehow simple and refreshing.

750 ml bottle from the LCBO. I heard it was a gusher so I left it in the fridge for more than a week and handled it very gently. It still gushed, but not much. Cloudy light yellow with massive white head, millions of tiny bubbles. Very lively carbonation. Smells like lime, lemons, peppery, some barnyard notes. Taste is the same, very tart, dry, refreshing. I could drink this all day long.
Bottle from LCBO. Pours hazy pale yellow, and nearly all head. Funky tart apple and spice aroma - very nice. Tart spicy wheat taste, tart finish. Tasty stuff.

2014/07/16 - What a gusher! Pours a hazy straw colour with a massive, gushing, frothy white head that leaves moderate lacing. Aroma is not at all what I had expected; Belgian yeast, wheat, Brett funk, citrus, light pepper and mild spice. Taste follows nose. Nice Brett funk balanced by tart citrus, mild pepper and clove/coriander spice. This is how I imagine a saison-wit hybrid would taste. Body is light to medium with sharp carbonation and a tart, refreshing finish. Pleasantly surprised by this interesting beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Didnt gush nearly as much as I feared it might, so huge points there. Very refreshingly tart, fascinating yeast character. Decent malt body underneath that balances the carbonation. Sharp citrusy notes in the finish which are very pleasing. Probably the only Witbier Ive ever had that could actually be described as remotely interesting.

Bottled. Pours hazy deep golden with a medium off-white head. Aroma of citrus, caramel, brett, yeast, wheat and spice. Sweet flavor that ends up dry, tart and a little bitter. Medium bodied, oily text. and average carb. A very nice Wit.

Gush pour opening 
gives my glass nothing but piles of foam. Patience & a cautious repour is in order. Pour redux brings a beautiful sunshine topped wiith a whipped meringue cap. This is a beautiful brew that shakes up expectations: slight spicing, citrus shards, & measured sourness make for a balanced drinking experience. Balance is the key here: nothing pushy, just a great drinking beer. Great brew to sip on as Germany prepares to crush Brazil at World Cup (Im sure the recent spat of hate mail my reviews are generating will make me eat my words if my prediction here is incorrect).

As Hangunder said "Nice tart/funky/barnyard notes mixed with belgian yeast. A gusher when it was opened. Hazy yellow with long lasting foamy white head." I should have chilled it a long time and opened it near a Duvel tulip! Attractive tart pale fruit and some herbal hops. Orval brett hides in the minglings of gentler flavors that are still full. Ah yeah, MANURE critters lurking in he aromas, how very biological.

This pours a cloudy orange yellow with a 1 finger head of foam that shrinks quickly. Lacing, yep.

Coriander, clove, banana, some bubblegum...pretty smelly, err aromatic. Hey is that some Brett in there?

It tastes like someone squeezed a fresh orange into my glass of this beer and then threw a blanket in it. A horse type blanket. The coriander and clove are there but that orange and Brett flavour is killing it. In a good way. I could drink a couple back to back.

The body seems to be medium at times but mostly light. Plenty of carbo.

A nice tasty Wit, for sure.

Nice tart/funky/barnyard notes mixed with belgian yeast. A gusher when it was opened. Hazy yellow with long lasting foamy white head. Funk at the beggining, finishing with some sour and belgian yeast notes. Not overly complex but a nice funky/spicy balance here. Medium bodied and highly carbonated. Pretty darn good, will pick up some more even given the steep price.

Draft at stags head. A great summer brew in my opinion. Pours light cloudy gold. Nose is lemony citrus and wheat. Tastes of orange peel, lemons, wheat, vanilla, and spicy coriander and white pepper. Zesty palate a d drying finish.
Pours a hazy golden color. Aroma is light orange citrus and tart. Taste is orange and wheat with a nice dry tartness. Enjoyable.
Draft at Clinton hall. Clear crisp cloudy color. . East drinking wheat beer with a sour flavor to it. Decent

Bottle at home from backlog notes. Pours a hazy golden color with a large fluffy white head that lasts. The aroma and flavor have wheat malts, orange peel, citrus, lightly tart, moderate Jolly Pumpkin funk, mild plus spices, very nice drinker that has more character than most Belgian whites.

Aroma is refreshing fruit, maybe peach. Pale yellow, white head, good carbonation. Tart but not exceedingly so. Fairly dry, and some dryness in the palate. Hint of spice. Very pleasant. Sort of like a light lambic.

Pours a bright hazy yellow with fluffy white head. Aroma is bright and sunny, a bit of citrus and raw grain, and a hint of fresh French oak. Taste is bright citrus, lemon and orange, lightly some unmalted wheat. A bit of wood brightens up the brew. Finishes with a long drying and slightly peppery.
12.7oz bottle. Hazy golden color with one finger head. Smells of citrus and oranges. Oranges taste with tart finish and a little peppery. Good beer.

Pours a hazy yellow with a foamy white head, reminiscent of a lemon. Has a strong aroma of orange and coriander and tart citrus. Flavor is dominated by the tart citrus, but theres also a touch of sweet yeast. The tartness is quite strong, and it gives the beer a very nice character. It may be a bit too tart for my tastes, but thats something thats starting to grow on me. Very good.

750ml capped bottle pours a hazy straw color with a medium sized head that settles slowly to reveal some spotty lacing on the glass. Aroma is yeasty with some hints of orange zest and coriander spice. Taste is an orange zest bitterness with a grainy malt sweetness followed up by a dry yeasty finish. Light bodied with abundant carbonation that tickles the palate nicely. A very pleasing brew that I recommend highly for others to try.

Im not a fan of the style, but its reasonably tasty. Aroma is yeast. Light yellow color. Taste is strong lemon, some orange, a tiny bit of spice - the usual suspects for this style. Theres a funkiness just lurking in the background that knocks it a bit off kilter. Its OK.

Bottle. Light hazy yellow with a large frothy white head. The orange peel comes through clearly, light coriander, dusty, light barnyard, wooden. Light/medium body, medium sweet, light sour and bitter, oily texture, medium/high carbonation. Very pleasant and refreshing. Finishes light sour with lingering orange notes. I could drink a lot of this.

750 ml bottle from Premier Gourmet. Pours a cloudy golden yellow with large, soapy white head. Aroma is fruity with notes of lemon and apple, some funkiness and gentle spice. Flavour is lemon zest, orange, apple, brett and light coriander. Drying finish. Very lively carbonation. Quite enjoyable.
Pours a cloudy light gold. Aroma is yeast with light citrus and spice. Body is light and has flavours of soda water, orange, yeast. So easy drinking.
Very nice for style. Aroma of coriander with some light bretta. Pours cloudy blonde with good head and lacing. Good balance, finishes sweet and sour in light overall doses. Tap at Churchkey.
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein trübes goldenes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch hefig, malzig, leichte Gewürze, fruchtig. Geschmack hefig, fruchtig, miniimal säuerlich, Citrus.

Pours a cloudy golden color with a huge white fluffy head. Lots of lacing left on the glass. Aroma is of lemon citrus zest, yeast and belgian spice. Taste is lemon, orange, slightly tart, dry, with a medium light mouthful. Overall an enjoyable beer. 1st beer I have had from the brewery and I am impressed. Look forward to more.

Bottle 750 ml at home, into a tumbler. Batch 867, Bottled 11/2011
Clear golden colour on the body with one finger of froathy head, low retention. Light lacing and the thinnest film of foam left on the surface.
Aroma has brett, citrus, apples.
Taste is refreshingly sour, lemony citrus flavour, apples. Not much of the coriander or the orange peel left in here, but the result is quite good.
Thin body, average carbonation. Very tart on the palate.
Overall nice, not your usual witbier.

Very nice beer by JP: basically a brettened up white beer. Pours gorgeous clear hazy yellow with a nice white head. Mouthfeel is big carbonation, medium bodied; very dry. Taste is wheat, banana, lemon cest, a bit of barnyard funk, Its a really nice, easy to drink beer.

On tap at Bigalora in Ann Arbor. Very smooth, but wish there was more of a bite. Not much on the nose. Pours a very light and clear orange.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Blonde trouble ayant une mousse sans grandes ambitions. Un nez propre au style, mais de façon plutôt faible. Des effluves dagrumes et des épices quelconques semblent être tout ce qui en émanent. Un goût qui se construit autour du zeste de citron avec de la coriandre et des pointes poivrées qui nous saisit un peu en bouche. Un côté suret sur les bords et aussi minéral. Plutôt aqueuse. Rafraîchissante, comme un Perrier au citron. Je reste sur ma faim. Est-elle trop vieille? (926-171213)

Batch 913. Bottled 10-10-2011. Rated 12-21-13. 
Aged 2+ years. Nice artwork. 
Pours an effervescent golden. Large fluffy, frothy white head, lasting. Big beautiful aroma. Yeasty, bretty, orange, citrus, coriander, some basement and old damp wood/light barnyard. Comfortable sourness, some citrus fruitiness, pleasant dryness. Soft, lighter medium body. The aged took most of the edge off the spices but are still present. Lots of yeast character and plenty of lemony like citrus. I liked this better than most of the other JP beers, although they all seem very similar, this one stands out a little more.

Aged 2+ years. 
Very yeasty, creamy, citrus aroma. Coriander, spices.
Taste is similar, very smooth, a little tart, lots of orange, citrus, and spices. Smooth but complex. A little dry at the finish, yes, but just barely.

Bottle at the parentals with my dad. Pour is hazy yellow with a big white head and great lacing. Funky, tangy, citrusy, lemony, peppery, biscuity, urine, grassy, biscuity, and honey in the aroma. Taste is spritzy, tart lemons, doughy, biscuity, white pepper, wheaty, basil, and citrus with a tangy tart finish. Medium mouthfeel with high carbonation. Really easy drinking, perfect for summer.

Bottle 750. Straw color, hazy but consistent all the way through. Smells of yeast, orange pith, ever so lightly spiced with coriander. Super light bodied, carbonation is fluffy which takes away some of the body. Taste is light, clean dry finish. Perfectly sessionable. Pair with a summer salad.

Bottle shared at a tasting at Tom Cs place. Pours an hazy yellow with a white head, aroma of brett, lactic tones, peach, nice aroma with some spices, flavor is wheaty and acidic, some lemon and grain, medium bodied

Bottle shared at a tasting at Tom Cs place. Cloudy golden with a big white head. Aroma is wheaty and spicy, a bit lemony, with great barnyard funk. Flavor is wheaty, sourish, and citric with bready notes, light sweetness, fruitiness and mild spiciness. Medium-bodied, lively carbonation. Really nice and refreshing.
Another solid beer from Jolly Pumpkin. Would like to have this one again. Mostly all Jolly Pumpkins I like to get again often.

Funky floral tropical fruit on te nose. Cloudy, opaque and tannish copper color. Tart and wheaty up front trailing off into a nice boozy banana finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

750 ml bottle into tulip glass, bottled on 4/17/2013. Moderate gusher upon opening, took a while to pour this. Pours very hazy golden straw color with a 3 finger foamy and rocky white head with great retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Spotty foamy lacing clings around the glass, with plenty of streaming carbonation retaining the head. Aromas of big tart lemon, green apple, pear, grape, orange peel, coriander, clove, pepper, wheat, wet hay, grass, floral, funk, and yeast earthiness. Damn nice aromas with good balance and complexity of yeast, spice, and malt notes; with good strength. Taste of tart lemon, pear, green apple, orange peel, clove, pepper, coriander, wheat, hay, grass, floral, funk, and yeast earthiness. Fair amount of crisp tartness/spiciness on the finish; with lingering notes of citrus, light fruits, clove, pepper, coriander, hay, grass, wheat, floral, funk, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a short bit. Very nice balance and complexity of yeast, spice, and light malt flavors; with a great fruity/spicy balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Very high carbonation and light-medium bodied; with a very crisp, prickly, and slightly acidic mouthfeel that is nice. Alcohol is very well hidden with minimal warming noticed after the finish. Overall this is an excellent oak aged witbier style. All around great balance and complexity of spice and yeast flavors; and extremely crisp and smooth to drink. A very enjoyable offering.

Pours a cloudy yellow with a large head. Aromas of that signature tart Jolly Pumpkin funk. Nice. Taste is initially slightly bitter, followed by waves of tart bliss. Smackingly dry finish. Like, like, like.

Tap at Cock and Bull Cinci, 4oz sampler, okay I get jolly pumpkins schtick is souring all their beer, but enough is enough, this is still a tasty treat, light hints of tart finish, slight amounts of coriander, though not enough to make it seem like a wit.. most people would be put off by the oddball smell.
On tap at Taps in Petaluma. Pours a pale straw color with a bit of head that sticks to the glass. Slight wild yeast sourness and fruity yeast flavor.
Pale yellow and heavily carbonated. Lemon zest, citrus, and and nice tart bite. Pretty tasty!

Reviewed 9-1-1o

I had this on draft at Pizza Paradiso in DC over on Dupont Circle.

Ap: Cloudy, almost peppery orange, with very little head, just a few bubble swirls on top.

Ar: Very unusual. Smells of pears, orange, coriander, sweet tarts, and pepper.

T: Even more unusual! VERY peppery, with tons of orange. The pepper cuts into the citrus and the two dont go very well together in this setting. Perhaps its because the carbonation is almost non-existent? Also, I could use more tartness overall. It tastes like diluted orange juice concentrate.

P: Like I said, not much carbonation, which I think would have benefited this one.

O: I wouldnt get this again. There are too many great Witbiers out there.
Pours golden with a slight haze and a white long-retaining head. Aroma of wheat, coriander, skunky notes, brett. Taste is nice and tart very refreshing. I like this a lot.

Bottle 750ml.
Pours whitish with almost no head. Aroma is of fruits, spices. Taste is of fruits (citrus), spices, soya milk. Palate: Light body. Overall: Not too bad. I that fear without the orange peel touch, this one would be below average.

UPDATED: OCT 19, 2014 Pours a cloudy yellow with a thin white head. Aroma is sour-ish, hinting at a different witbier than what you are used to. There is also some nice wheat notes in there. Taste is lightly tart and showcases wheat and spices quite elegantly. Quite a bit fruity also. Light bodied and quaffable plenty. Really refreshing. Nice!

Taste is good, light wheat that is soon overpowered by tart citrus flavors that linger on into the finish. Finish has lots of spice pepper, coriander mingle and spice up the citrus. Nice dry woody finish with hints of vanilla and touches of vinegar.

post-cascade + upright tasting sessions - coz were porks. pours hazy light yellow with a small white cap, some retention and lacing. wheaty acidic - mainly lactic, lemon, skunky and sulfur relatively dominant notes that eventually and gladfully faded, spicy coriander and other herbs, maybe a touch of flowers. lively to average carbonation, light body, herbal-spicy and citric-lactic finish. tart and refreshing, but linear.

Bottle (750 ml). From Chris, thanks! Slightly hazy yellow with a small white head and little lacing. Aroma is of light funk, orange peel, lemon and coriander. Taste is about the same. Light body. Moderate carbonation. Slightly dry mouthfeel. Good Witbier with a light sour twist (less than most other JP beers though). Refreshing.

750 ml bottle shared with Tom and chums. Pours a veiled whitish straw with a short lived white head. Aroma is coriander, wheat. Flavor is wheat, oranges, coriander, yeast. Finish is woody, lemoney, oldish, dry. Lingering lemon. Light to medium body, average to strong carbonation. Seriously, is something supposed to be special about this?
Bottle from Tom10101, thanks a lot. Pour is hazy golden with white head. Aroma of wheat, coriander, skunky notes, brett. Taste is wheat, coriander, brett, skunk, brett, oak. Low body and medium carb.

Pours piss yellow with no real head. Aroma is apple skins and vinegar. Flavor is sharp tart with some sweetness, carb too sharp. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours a light Jay golden. Aromas of lemon and funk. Also some spice. Nice funky flavours, some lemon and soap too. I really liked this. Very much like a saison.
Very Belgian wit like, lightly bretty and like oak flavors, yhis is pretty awesome
Nice spices and citrus on nose. More of the same on palate. Doesnt kill you with coriander which is nice. Clean crisp dry finish

Draft at the Sybarite Pig in Boca Raton, FL. Snifter. Pours a yellowish haze with thick, fluffy white head. Retention good, lacing also good. Aroma of fruits such as pears, apples, banana and lemons. A little brett aroma as well. The taste was complex with apples, pears, bananas, bread, orange. Tart, dry finish. Light body. Very crisp and refreshing.

Pour out of 750 mL bottle from Cornerstar, 2013 batch 36. Hazy yellow pour with big, fluffy, lasting white head, aroma brought notes of nice earth, biscuit, cracker sweetness, nice coriander, clove, hints of orange peel, lemon, touch of wild yeast with some bretty barnyard like notes. Taste is a mix of nice white fruits, some orange, going into biscuit, bread, slight yeast, touch of coriander, finishing with some slight funk, slight acidity. Tasty stuff.
Overall great beer, bottle, hazy pour thick white head, hints of pear and other fruit, good!

Pours a hazy golden yellow with a white head. Very foamy. Huge thick head even with a gentle pour. Taste is very nice though. Pear, apple, oak, wheat, slightly tart. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma of citrus... Flavor is frothy and foamy... Light body, like a hoegaarden. Floral notes, hints of spice and grains on palate... Delicious and refreshing 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours a cloudy golden color with thin head.  Aromas of citrus and yeast.  Some spicy peppery notes upfront.  Very dry throughout with a nice tartness.

Hazy yellow with medium white head.
Aroma.. wheat, citrus, some spices, quite malty.
Bit sweet and intense sour.. too sour
Maybe not bad, but definitely not for me.. quite thin and sour

bottle.   Aroma - champagne like , sweet malty profile with notes of bubble gum and fruits. Pours pale, cloudy with medium white top, good foam retention, min lacing. Taste is dominant sour with backbone of herbal hopping bitter. Palate - light body, watery texture, fresh, short finish. Cause of sour it is not my type at all, but as a view widener I would say nice brew.

Bottle from 16 Tons, Eugene. Labeled Batch 939, Bottled 11-14-2011. Pours extremely foamy, color is a light golden orange, slightly cloudy. Aroma is huge, very funky, with some estery notes as well as maybe banana. Spices just barely there, honestly. WTF? Body is light, lively, slightly, tart, not as heavy or malty as a Hoegaarden or a more classic exemplar of the style. Finish is sweet without being cloying, citrus comes back in. JP strikes again!

On tap at Republic, super pale yellow color with thin white head. Aroma is lemon, straw and some yeast funk. Taste is a bit of lemon, light sour pucker, light body, could be a good sour starter beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

(Bottle) Tart and very acrid scent of citrus, reminiscent of detergent. Not nice! The taste is tart and bitter citrus with notes of hops and spices (sage). Crisp and edgy flavor! Do not understand why this beer gets such high ratings, maybe theres was something wrong with the one I tasted?

UPDATED: MAY 26, 2013 An almost clear straw yellow with a decent head and little lacing.  Aroma has some funkiness with a definite sour note and spicing.  Taste is like aroma, mildly tart with a bit if funkiness, citrus and spicing from the coriander.  Mouthfeel is soft and fizzy, medium bodied with high carbonation.  Really nice combination of flavors with a tartness that doesnt overpower but serves to make the beer refreshing.  I really liked it.    

---Jeremy H

2011 bomber to a snifter.  Pours a light straw yellow with a little haze and a fizzy white head.  Aroma is a tart barnyard smell with the coriander and the orange balancing it out.  Taste is tart with a slight sour undercurrent.  Very pleasant on the tongue.  Finishes very dry and clean.  Refreshing and perfectly balanced. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap 4 oz. pour at Meridian Pint in Columbia Heights, Washington, DC.

Mildly hazy, straw-yellow with a white head and amazing lacing.

Aroma of lemon, orange, grain and yeast.

Taste of citrus, grain, and yeast.

Light/medium body and high/medium carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Questo birrificio non sbaglia un colpo!

A distinct sour feel but the taste remains undisturbed. A golden opaque color and a shirt white head

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a dark couldy yellow. Nose is citrus and spice, with mouth smooth, spicy, lemony and sourness Not my favorite style so certinaly not an expert here. Did pair nicely with the baked cod I was having at the time though. Im glad to try it.

UPDATED: DEC 30, 2013 Tap at Blue Nile. Slightly hazy yellow pour with a huge white head. Orange, lemon, spice, and a bit of sour/tart that leads to a slightly dry finish. One of the best Ive had in this style.
From bottle.  Nice orange color and the aroma has some farmhouse funk and citrus.  Nice carbonation with orange and spice and barnyard and sweet/tart finish that ends dry.  Really nice white ale.

Bottle:  I recently discovered this brewer and have enjoyed everything Ive sampled thus far.  This White Ale is no different.  The beer pours a hazy white with a nice creamy head.  The notes of citrus combine with Jolly Pumpkins signature zest to create a very artistic White.  This light drinking ale has a low ABV and JPs ultra-tart finish, a tribute to their unique yeast strain and oak barrel aging processes.   One of my favorite locals, for sure.
Ikd rate here. One of my fav beers from these guys. Light, tart, refreshing, slight wheat. Transcends the style.
Nose is funky, spicy, and musty Brett funk, fruitiness. Flavor is spices, acetic tartness, funk with a crisp carbonated dry and tart finish. Nice saison.

Bottle. Golden, fizzy clear disappearing head. Nose is orange coriander, lemon peel, funk, spices. Taste is lemon cookies, orange coriander, light spices. Dry, slightly tart finish. Really light mouthfeel fitting for the style.

Bottle. Pours a cloudy orange-straw with a finger of fine white head that settles to a thin cap in minutes. A little lacing. Aroma is slightly sour/lactic, citrus, herbal, barnyard. Flavor is mildy sour up front, building slightly, citrus, fading into herbal, slight spice, and wheat/grain tones, and finishing with a hints of oak. Oak seems to become more pronounced as it warms. Sour and citrus tones work really well together. Moderate carbonation, medium body, and a mildly dry finish. A nice balance of tart and flavor with smooth oak tones. A tasty beer.

Bottle as shown. Pours a cloudy yellow with a small white head leaving spotty lacing. The aroma is a strong orange peel and spice. Thin mouthfeel with a light sour fruit and spice with nice tart finish. A very good wit from Jolly Pumpkin.

Bouteille de 750ml de la batch 406. Au St-Bock avec Pat. Bière dorée avec une mousse blanche qui nest pas trouble. Le nez est de malt pils, une touche de citron et un peu de blé complète les arômes. En bouche la bière nest pas aussi sur les brett, Jolly nous a habitué à des bières très «funky»,  ici ça lest un peu moins, elle est courte et mince. La finale est sur les épices. Cest ainsi que jai cru que cette dégustation se termina, mais non, la levure, la bière devenue trouble, elle sétait transformée. Elle passa de 5 à 7 sur 10.

Une bouteille (batch 406) partagée avec rodenbach99.  Un nez simple de citron, de levures sauvages et dépices à la blanche.  Au goût, de la pulpe et le zest dun citron portugais avec des saveurs mordantes de blé et des flaveurs microbiennes qui permettent une formation acidulée et légèrement aigre.  Une bouche pleine de vie.  Un corps plutôt mince.  Une texture rafraîchissante.  Une finale courte de notes citronnées et épicées et moyennement longue de levures sauvages.  Agréable comme tout et bien facile à boire.

On tap. Hazy gold / whitish color. Nice white head, leaves good lace. Definitely a nice-looking witbier. Nice light spice nose - coriander, orange zest. Light body. Very nice smooth carbonation. Surprisingly, this is the least sour Jolly Pumpkin brew Ive had yet. Its real zesty, but barely even tart. Didnt expect that, but the taste is great for a witbier. Good orange peel and belgian yeastiness. Definitely one of the best witbiers Ive ever had, and reasonably true-to-style with minimal gimmicks, too (Anchorages White comes to mind - great, but not your typical Wit)

Draft to taster. Looks solid; a hazy yellowish-orange with LOTS of white head. Smells tart, citrusy, and yeasty. Tastes like it smells, but less prominent. Average on the palate. Alright, but nothing special.

Bottle. It pours a brilliantly clear yellow color with a large, fizzy white head. The aroma has a nice balance of lightly tart lemons, orange, coriander and JP funk. Maybe a touch of vanilla from the wood. The flavor is mildly tart with more orange, spices and lemony funk with light citrus peel bitterness. Very well balanced and tasty.

Flight @ beer shoppe. 3oz. Aroma:Light some citrus, champagne yeast, vanilla(?) Appearance: Pale yellow straw...lively carbonation. Taste: Citrus with some sourness. Palate: Smooth and clean with some sour bite to it. Lingers on the palate a bit. Overall: Alright, but I wouldnt buy a bottle.
Bottle. Pours a very slightly hazy golden color with a thick head that quickly disappears. Definitely some citrus in the nose. Taste is light and citrusy also. Would be a great summer drink.

Bottle from City Beer. tart lemony aroma, yogurt, dust, barrel. Dry, citrus flavor, dusty, grassy, coriander not so evident. Wheat, nicely aged and funky. Slightly sweet orange, plus some tropical fruits as well. Also minerals, like alka seltzer a bit. Quite highly carbonated and fizzy. Nicely dry finish, slightly tart. Very refreshing a clean beer. Very good. Great balance.

A little bland for my tastes here. Decent beer with slight sourness. Pours hazy white. Fluffy head and yeasty aroma.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

10/6/12. 750mL bottle from Grassroots. I was surprise to see I hadnt already rated this one. Here goes. Hazy orange pour with a big, fluffy off-white head at first that fades to a soapy ring and laces a touch. Nice tart, lightly sour, wood aged aroma with Brett, some vanilla, and hints of citrus. Much lighter flavor than expected, however, that shows light citrus, doughiness, a hint of tartness, and some wood and vanilla and a hint of metal. The promising aroma combined with the light flavor makes this extremely refreshing and easy drinking. For a cheaper price, Id drink this stuff all the time.
Hazy yellow with a big white head. Aroma is wheaty, coriander, yeasty, citrus and tart. Flavor is medium sweet and light acidic. Dry and light acidic finish. 300912

Bottle, . Slightly hazy yellow with small white head. Aroma is malt, wheat. spices and funk. Flavour is malt, wheat, little sour, wood, little brett, little coriander, little dry, high carbonation, hop and a little bitter.
Bottle. Nice head with medium duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are wheat malt, coriander, orange, brett and hops. Nice and funky.
bottle. golden yellow with one finger head. very tart with lemon and coriander. decent funk to this. very tasty.

Bottle 750ml (Batch #835) @ home
Pours cloudy golden with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, wheat, coriander, orange with a hint of sourness.Taste is light sweet, light bitter and light sour with a long dry, light sour finish. Body is medium, texture is thin to oily, carbonaiton is soft.

Bottle at home. Pours a slightly hazy straw-yellow colour with a medium white head. Sour aromas of vinegar, citrus, wood, tar and some spices. I find much of the same in the flavour but with a more pronounced bite of berries. Has a soft and sparkly mouthfeel, and a very light bitterness. A good beer with a nice balance.
Bottle thanks to djd07. Pours white with a small head. Brett yeasty nose with a hint of lemon. Taste is very mild, similar to a wit beer.  Lemon, a bit of tart, smooth going down. Good summer beer.
user_location: Seattle still not near Beersel., Washington, USA

text: Cloudy yellow pour from a bottle. I can sum up this beer succinctly. What if you made a Belgian white as a sour? Calabaza Blanca is the result and it is delicious.
Interesting, this tastes 100 percent JP, but it has a definite Belgian white flavor. Wild.

Bottle shared by esp0r july 28th 2012, thanks a lot!
Cloudy golden color, low white head. 
Aroma is funky, spicy and with citrus fruits. 
Taste is very Jolly Pumpkin-yeasty, with lemon and wheat. Good sour and bitter palate, lasting aftertaste. Quite refreshing!
pours a hazy apricot color with a white foam head, nice lacing, smell and taste of lemon rhind,  slightly tart/funky but an overall delicious bottle of beer
Pours hazy lemon with a fluffy well laced three finger white head. Smell is spicy flowery coriander clover orange and lemon zest. Taste is spritzy, slight tart lemon, wheat, clove, fantastic beer

Pours a hazy pale yellow with a medium white head...nice lacing and retention.  Aroma has light funkiness and clovey spice.  Flavor is spice forward...tea notes, mild citrus and funk creeping in.  Mouthfeel is medium with a dry spicy/funky finish...citrusy tea lingers.  Good but a bit odd.

Bottle from Vika shared with daje
Golden hazy, white head. Smells of funk, cellar must, orange peel, some spice but not the coriander type, also some malts. Light sweet, quite dry, tart apple, hints of lactic acids. Quite carbonated, smooth and dry on the palate. Very light bitter, some fruit bitterness. This beer is very refreshing, and a very different try to take on the wit style. Typical aromas and flavors from the wit blended in with the classic funky jolly pumpkin yeast characters. I would love to try this one again one time

Cloudy golden pour with a large fluffy white head. Nose is stinky cheese, old dough, very earthy, touches of citrus and oak. Funky yeast on the front of tongue, more earth and cheese with lemon peels. Medium bodied and good carbonation. Ends dry with a bit of tartness. Very tasty and refreshing.

750ml bottle from Discount Liquor Milwaukee, split with my bride.  Pours a cloudy, yellow color with a huge white head.  Aroma is yeasty, funky, typical Jolly Pumpkin smell.  Medium on the palate with lively carbonation.  Flavor is sweet-tart, citrus, lemon, wheat, yeast, with a light tart finish. Reminiscent of traditional Belgian Whites, with the JP twist.

750 ml bottle bought @ Ølbutikken. Pours hazy pale golden with a rather big frothy white head that quickly dissipates without leaving much trace. Smell is sweet, spicy and funky with crackers, cloves, white pepper, hay, wood, brett, green grapes, dry soil, plums, oatmeal cookies, lemon zest  and hints of leather and barnyard. Taste is very tiny sweet and quite sour with crackers, lemon juice, hay, lemon zest, dry soil, green grapes, unripe plums, wheat flour, barnyard and hints of sour milk, manure and horse blanket. Mouthfeel is mousse like, watery, dry, tart and light bodied. Finish is sour and slightly tart with lemon juice, grape zest, lemon zest, hay, dry soil, crackers and barnyard. Very refreshing, amazing smell and solid taste.

pours translucent golden yellow, small head , lots of active CO2 streams. Sour malts on the nose. Lemony sourness (8/10) up front, mild barnyard, coriander, fruity sweetness (4/10). Medium complexity, medium-high depth, good transitions, good carry, great drinkability.

750ml bottle from Liquor Loft.  Hazy light yellow pour with huge fluffy white head and good retention.  Aroma is tart apple, lemon, coriander, bread and funk -- pretty amazing smells.  Flavor is orange peel, lemon, yeast, light spices, wheat and oak -- well balanced with a nice light tart kick.  We got a chance to try several JPs for the first time recently at the cafe in Ann Arbor and were underwhelmed.  So, was surprised how much I liked this one.  Very nice.

750 ml bottle. Pours golden with a slight haze and a white long-retaining head. Aroma is full of brett--reminiscent of dusty old bookshelves--lemon. Just what I needed at the moment. Taste is nice and tart--total Jolly Pumpkin. It tastes nothing like a witbier, but it sure tastes mighty fine.

750 ml. bottle, thanks Poisoneddwarf- Pours hazy golden with a creamy one finger head that holds nicely. The aroma is brett, tart, fruity, lemon, yummy. The taste is funky tart, not much lemon, smooth as hell, summer chugger that you dont want to chug, because it is just too good, and expensive. Body is medium, carbonation is high. Loved it.
75cl bottle at Schouskjelleren (batch 835). Pale yellow with a white head. Aroma of citrus, spices, wheat and hops. Medium sour and citric with a dry finish.  Very nice and refreshing!

On bottle at Schouskjelleren .
Golden color, good foam.
Stable aromas 
Light / medium body & medium complexity.
Intense sourness, long bitter aftertasteenjotable


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottles, pours a hazy golden color with the usual massive j.p. head and great lacing. Notes of coriander, orange peel, brett, breead, and some other spices. Very carbonated, easy drinking summer wit that can replace your shitty blue moon intake. Buy American, Buy Craft.

75 cl bottle. Batch 835; bottled 7.7.2011. Rated 31.5.2012.

Pale, hazy straw w/ nice head and retention. Tart, wheaty, citrusy, slightly funky. Dry, drinkable, and very well-balanced.
(bottle) cloudy yellow colour with medium tall white head; aromas of citrus, dough, spices; balanced flavour
750 ml bottle. Pours a clear yellow/gold with a persistent light head. Aromas of lemons and yeast. Sour and tart. Flavors of green apples, lemons, and coriander. Very distinctive.
very pale yellow with a white head. Sure it is OK beer but this style is not my style.
Notes denvelliment en barrica molt delicades. Fina, lleugera però gran, molt gran.
Pours hazy golden yellow   aroma of grass, lemon , barnyard hay. Tart flavor with citrus lemon and grassy flavors   unique excellent rfrshing beer  i like this one !

A - pours very clear straw yellow with high tight bubbled head that leaves a thin layer of bubbled. S - aromas of light Belgian yeasts, nice fruity notes of apples, pear  and bananas. Nice cloves and corriander. very nice light summery floral notes. M - very nice light summery brew. Light and subtle palate, that leads to a less interesting light lager aspect of a macro. The slightly tangy end saves it. T - lightly tangy apple, grassy funk, cloves and coriander up front. Light lager, bananas and Belgian yeasts on the palate. Lingering tangy apple and cloves. O - very good light sour belgian type ale. 7

0.75l bottle #835. Pours a light hazy straw yellow body with a nice big and lasting fluffy white head. Wheaty aroma with strong citrus totes. Also some near herbal touches here, and a nice twitch of orange and tropical fruits. Quite nice. Oh, yeah, we are now in Jolly pumpkin-land when it comes to the taste. Light and subtle sour-ish flavors, lots of wheaty lemon and it ends mildly mouth-drying. A bit watery perhaps, but quite light drinkable. A wit with a nice sour turn. 03.03.2012
13th August 2009Hazy pale gold beer. Dry crisp palate. Slightly sour with a little lemon and orange citrus. Very dry crisp finish. Seems quite sour for a Witbier but not as bad as a proper sour.

Bottle from Vinmonopolet in Valkendorfsgate, Bergen. Pours a hazy, bubbly straw-yellow body with a big, solid creamy white head. Nose is well-rounded coriander seed, sweet wheat and citric notes, with hints of vanilla and sour wood; JP style.
