Taste is sour citric tones with some barrel marks on them; vanilla and dry wood seems to reappear from this first encounter in the aftertaste. In between, wheat with subtle sweet (banana?) hints and light grains play upon each other. Light body and moderate carbonation. This one is a real thirst-quencher, while still retaining a rather high level of complexity. Not bad, I must say - the little extra vanilla/tartness from the usual JP treatment suits the beer very much indeed. Maybe not the best wit Ive had, but certainly in the top segment of the list. :-)
Lovely hazy yellow colour with a white head. Wheat and light citric nose. Wheat and citric flavour with a light sourness.[Bottle from Vinmonopolet Vika in Oslo, Norway]
really good aroma, golden and hazy in appearance. really good head. really nice wheat beer taste with a slight sourness from the wild yeast

750 mL bottle. Pours pale yellow with a medium, white head. The aroma is lemons, wheat, and seltzer water. The flavor is citrus sweetness, and very tart. The palate is light to medium, very bubbly and crisp. Overall, this is a pretty good witbier, but nothing special.
En botela.palida,limpia carbonatada pero con poca retención,aromas a especies ,naranja....buen final seco.interesante

Pours slightly turbid, almost clear golden straw with a rocky head that lasts (perhaps to effervescence).  Aroma only suggests tartness, mostly grassy citrus, close to lemon peel, followed by the reminiscent doughy, yeasty belgian wit aroma. Some subtle funk, barnyard on the nose too.  The taste is more tart than the armoa and spices come through strong, but not out of balance.  Soft "wonderbread" doughy malt in background, but present.  It is bubbly on the palate, with a quick and dry finish. 

It is too bad this is so expensive because it is a wonderful session "plus" : with just a bit more complexity than most wits but wonderfully drinkable. Drink this!

Starts with moderately tart orange and lemon with some mustiness. Wheat and black pepper join next with a dry citrus & coriander finish. The alcohol is well hidden. This is fairly dry for a Witbier, which really makes it shine
Draft at Leroys in Montgomery.  Pours light yellow with thin white head.  Funky aroma.  Nice Brett flavor.
Hefig-strenger Geruch, leichte Würznote. Recht sauer im Antrunk. Mitte hefig, sauer und eher schwach gewürzig. Leicht malziger, zitroniger und gewürziger Abgang. Geht so.

Couleur doré très pale habité par la levure en suspens. Coriandre, lime et une acidité bien soutenu en arôme qui se transpose en bouche. La finale est franche, sûr et sèche. Buvabilité excellente mais quelque peu ralenti par lacidité.

Picked this up at Hill Farmstead in Vermont.This is batch 835 bottled on 7-7-2011. Poured into an Ommegang glass both at room temp.

A - Poured a single crystal clear head with nice creamy bubbles. Very pale almost wheat looking beer. Cloudy Pale ale look but with loads of yellow and white and clouds.

S - Sour Lambic smell. Orange peel is HUGE in this beer. Its still nicely balanced with the sour and some floral scent.

T - Tart & sour is the primary thing. Lemon, Orange, Wheat and Belgian Yeast.

M - Huge carbonation 90% on a single swish. Sour and tart linger.

O - Great beer. Almost perfect but its just too dry for my taste.

Bottle picked up somewhere a month or two back. Served in a SAVOR wine glass.

Pours a clear light golden color with a thin white head and some spotty lacing. The nose carries some really great wheat character along with a light touch of oak and funk. Slight acidity there as well. Reminds me a bit of a berliner. Flavor confirms that last point. The wheat and bugs combine for a really pleasing dryness. Great balance and supreme drinkability. Light body with crisp -- yet not over the top -- carbonation. Slight acidity to the finish. Extremely solid. Beautiful beer.
On tap at Bangers & Lace Chicago. Refreshing and sweet. Maybe too sweet. Banana and vanilla flavors. Not tart in my opinion.

Pours pale opaque yellow with a huge, thick, dense creamy head that stays for the whole glass.  Aroma is subtle tartness, clove, pear, apple.  Taste is lemon, French oak, subtle hay/farmyard, some yeast, apple, and pear.  Body is light and effervescent, slick, medium carbonation.  Overall, pretty good but not one of my faves from JP.

Clear golden with big white head, moderate retention, nice lacing... Tart Bretty lemony aroma... Light tart yeasty wheaty dry dry finish lively some definite fruity notes citrus bubblegum loads of fruits under the wheat... Tart dry finish great refreshing summer beer

Big bottle, batch 835, bought at Vinmonopolet Vika. Unclear, grey-golden body colour, firm white head, spotty lace. Hay, wheat and coriander to the nose. Dry, tart and sweet elements in the taste profile. Dry citrus shells. Lingering dry, bitter fruity ending. Medium bodied. Refreshing witbier. Should be very nice on a hot summers day (hotel room, Oslo 05.01.2012).

750ml bottle.  This is the best wit beer I have tried.  The aroma is filled with apples, citrus, lemons, spices, sweet malt notes. The flavor is similar, apples, spices, lemon, citrus, and sweet malts.  A fun, interesting beer.

(Bottle) Pale golden colour with frothy, white head. Fruity, slightly acidic nose with notes of yeast, lemon peel, peaches, grass, jasmine and a touch of barnyard. Fruity taste with lemon, grass, hints of yeast, coriander, dry white wine and slightly funky hints of barnyard. A dry, refreshing tartness in the finish. Medium body, dry. More character than in most witbiers, with influences from both lambic and bière de garde. Nice and tasty with lots of character.

Bottle. Fizzy white head that doesnt stay long, slight gusher; very hazy lemon yellow. Light spice, funk, sourness, oaky, and sour peach. Nice tartness, hay, slight tart peaches and pear...citrusy and finishes slightly sour.  Lighter body with good carbonation.  Tasty.

On tap at JP Ann Arbor. Pours hazy golden with white head. Looks good so far. Aromas of lemon, wheat, coriander, and a bit if tartness. Flavors of wheat, lemon, nice tartness, little coriander and light spices JPs beers are all sour, but this is a pretty solid wit either way. Nice carbonation and mouthfeel. I like lighter colored sours in general for some reason and found this beer to be really nice. Really opening my eyes to JP in some ways.

Bottle (Batch 724, bottled 1/31/2011). Pours a clear pale golden yellow with a quick white head that fades to a wispy film and collar. Aroma is faint apple and lemon with a tart rind scent and yeast. Taste is crisp bitter sourness and yeast with a little citrus and barnyard funk. Palate is thin and fizzy with a dry finish. Another solid brew!

UPDATED: NOV 28, 2011 Draught at burger. Hazy pale yellow. Lactic aroma with some citrus and floral spice. Light to medium sourness. Not much spice character. More like a tart berliner. But good. Nice session beer if not worth the bottle price. I was really looking forward to this after reading about it in Brewing With Wheat, but maybe this batch just wasnt the best.

On tap at ann arbor cafe. Pours hazy straw gold with a smallish white head. Spicy goodness. Cloves, peel, light bread, grains and a touch of farmhouse funk. Very refreshing taste - part tart, spicy, citrusy and dry grainy bready finish, tart continuing well through for a very crisp and complex finish. Possibly the best Belgian Wit Ive ever had.

Refrigerated bottle poured into a weizen glass.  Pours cloudy light orange with large yellow hightlights with two inch white head.  Medium/heavy  lacing, lively carbonation, and medium/light body.  Taste is tart citrus, some funky yeast, and a hint of coriander.  Really acid for a belgian white.  I prefer St. Bernarudus.

750mL bottle, pours a cloudy yellow with a white head. Aroma of citrus, yeast, and champagne. Flavour is extremely citrusy and somewhat sour, due to the barrels, clove and yeast - highly carbonated and medium complexity. Quite decent.

Caged cork 750ml bottle from 16th St. Liquor in West Vancouver. Poured a hazy orange tinged gold with thin white head. Aroma of wheat, bread, sour dough and citrus. Flavour is lightly sweet and bitter with a touch of sourness. Light bodied mouthfeel with average carbonation. Overall a refreshing citrus witbier.

Serving: 750 ml. bottle from State Line Liquors.  It pours a cloudy pale gold with a large, frothy, white head.  The nose has touch of lemon, funk, yeast, coriander, and cardamom.   The flavor is light and spritzy with a touch of sourness, soft malt, lemon pith, and spices.  Light in body and very easy drinking with average carbonation leading to a short, effervescent finish.  Really easy to drink and a pleasure at that.  I can see why this brew is so highly rated.  Lots of layers of flavors that work well together.  Definitely recommended.

Pours a hazy dull yellow. Active carbonation with a large white head. Aroma is very interesting. Kinda bready and tells signs of tartness. Same with taste. Really refreshing and pleasently dry and tart...i love this combination. No hop presence.

Bottle at HOPS! Oktoberfest. Pours a very attractive yellow white with a sticky white head, hazy. Nose is refreshing, notes of yoghurt and citrus, soft acidity and big bready malts. Minimal hop notes, soft oak as well. on tasting, nice and crisp tart note that works well with the citrusy coriander and soft orange peel. Not really witbier, but a distant relative for sure. Really nice and soft beer with a good wheat profile and soft acidity. Good stuff.
Draft at jolly pumpkin. Pours light yellow with a thin white head. Big sour aroma. Some orange peel on the tongue. Big sourness on the swallow which finishes clean.

Pours a murky straw yellow with a thin white head.  Smells of sour oranges, some spices, and barnyard funk with a strong vinegar aroma coming through as well.  The taste is extremely misleading from the style this really is.  Extremely sour with some good lip pucker going on.  Funky barnyard, sour fruits, and rather light on the spices.  Interesting, but very tastey!
Lätt och syrligt som när lambic möter veteöl som möter ljus belgisk ale. Trevligt en fin sommardag.
Had on tap @itap. Pours a golden with a huge white head. Aroma is citrus funk, lemon, yeast. Flavor is sour, citrus, orange, coriander and a bit tart. Has a tart and spicy  finish. pretty good beer.

A: The beer pours a rather clear golden amber color with a massive white head that is very well retained.

S: A rather strong note of green apples and apple skins to the aroma.  There is a light spice character to it as well as some musty oak and a little bit of grass and pear.

T: The flavor is sort of muddled.  There are some of the same apple and pear notes with a light lemon zest tartness.  Musty funk is there, as with almost all Jolly Pumpkin beers.  Very light spice notes on the back end.

M: Light to medium in body with a rather high level of carbonation and a drying finish.

O: Good, but it didnt impress me as much as other Jolly Pumpkin beers.

Bottle shared with Doug at The Bayou 
Appearance: Slightly hazy orange with a medium sized white head and some lacing 
Aroma: Tart cherries and spices 
Taste: Tart fruit, spices with a dry finish 
Good, clean and refreshing on a hot night sitting on the patio

Bottle at the Bayou. Pours a cloudy yellow color with a large white head. The aroma is sweet lemons and a citrus funk. The flavor is smooth somewhat tart fruit, certainly lemons, oranges, some light dry yeast. Quite dry but a rich flavor. Nice.

66 cl bottle.
Pours cloudy yellow colour with large bubbly head. Aroma is sour, reminds me a bit of Orval, citrus, soap and grass as well. Flavour is earth, sour with citrus, notes of apricot and some spices. Palate is all the way sour with a bitter finish. A bit saison-like, lots of carbonation. Very refreshing and enjoyable wit.
3365

66 cl bottle, Batch 343, no BBE info
Really sour aroma with some salt and earthy notes, very typical to JP. Salty and citrus-like sour flavour with earthy notes and hints of spices. Very dry and sour finish. A bit too much CO2 on palate. One of the best witbiers Ive had, but not very loyal to its style.

im guessing a got an old bottle of this, judging from the other reviews here. mine was one dimensionally sickeningly sweet, basically like bananas foster in a glass. brain pour it was so bad. maybe can try it again someday.
Pours a hazy pale straw color without much of a head. Coriander and yeast dominate the aroma. Crisp light apple cider like flavor with a little barnyard

UPDATED: APR 27, 2012 bottled 5-24-11 batch 810. pours a hazy gold with a hint of copper. medium sized fluffy head falls quick. smells lemony with slight band aid, wheat sweetness with a moderate dry funk. taste is tart upfront like lemon citrus. white wheat breadiness. ends mostly dry. light/ medium body with moderate/high carbonation, smooth mouthfeel.
Hazy golden-white with a large head. Some witty flavours of coriander, citrus and wheat and a wild tartness. Interesting stuff!

Bottle on 12/31/2010. Batch 416. Clear golden body with a huge foamy white head. Tart fruit and light wheat aroma. Tart fruit, light oak, on a wheat background. Medium light body with moderately high carbonation.

Hazy straw yellow with a frothy two-finger head that left only modest lacing. Strong barnyard and yeast aromas, including hay and toast. Tart, almost sour flavor, featuring wheat, lemon and spices. Light body, gigantic carbonation, and a crisp citrusy finish.
Catching up on some ratings. I like this style and I like this beer, something in the finish gave me a funky aftertaste - intended or not.

UPDATED: AUG 2, 2011 It pours a very cloudy straw yellow color into my Funky Buddha snifter.  Big bubbly white head.  The nose is of brett and lemon.  The taste is more lemon along with a grassy taste and some yeast funkiness.  It finishes dry and crisp.
750ml bottle-pours a thin retaining white head and cloudy yellow/straw color.  Aroma is wheat/light malt/hay/barn, some light fruit.  Taste is wheat/light malt/hay/barn, some light fruit-tart.  Easy.

Batch 298. 

The beer pours a straw gold color with a huge white head. The aroma is classic Jolly Pumpkin. I get a lot of wheat and lemon/orange notes, as well as a ton of brett character. There is a little bit of funk as well as a lot of leather notes in the aroma. 

The flavor is great. I get a lot of leather notes as well as some orange citrus. There is some nice wheat and lemon notes mixed in as well. The beer is very dry overall and is very drinkable. As the beer warms I start to get some cherry notes in the flavor. 

Medium mouthfeel and low to medium carbonation. Outstanding overall.

Pours from the bottle a lemon yellow colour with a white head that lasts. The nose and taste are both very citrusy although I found this beer a bit thin. The predominant flavour is lemon although this beer is missing some of the barnyard funk I normally associate with this style. Not bad.

[22 fl oz bottle, courtesy of cgarvieuk] Very pale pour, a clear lemon yellow. Thin lacing around the glass after a few seconds. Sharp citrus aroma. Big, effervescent palate that was refreshing and very cleansing. Citrus fruit sharpness leading into a dry finish. Very nice indeed [02062011]

2 June 2011, bottle at one of CGarvieuks legendary tastings! very pale yellow, clear, no bubbles, foamy white head. great nose. this is a mild belgian sour. not heavily tart but definitely in that arena. thin body and mildly fizzy. nice mild tartness. dry white grapes. really nice and not off putting.
Bottle at home ... golden yellow ... bubbly white head ... light citrus orange zezty nose ... fizzy ... light tart front ... little wheaty ... soft lemon ... ligth and easy ... no real sourness.

The smell is definately belgian white, subtle fruits and a bit of sour.  Color is a beautiful yellow hue, tinting to the gold side.  Large white thick head and some decent lacing.  It is a light summer beer in flavor, very drinkable no need for orange or any other "garnish".  Fizzy yet dry, with a sour afternote.  This is another enjoyable beer from Jolly Pumpkin that reminds you of the season.

650 ml bottle @ Oliver Twist, Stockholm. Rated @ 23.5.2011.
Pours a slightly hazy yellow colour with a patchy white head. Aroma of strong sour fruits with some yeast. Flavour of sour, juicy fruits, mild spices and some yeast. Medium bodied with a slick mouthfeel and a sour, fruity, finish. Nice sour witbier.
Poured into a snifter. Appearance is a hazy gold with a thick white head. Aroma is Brett and esters. Taste is initially esters and sour brett. Pretty interesting take on the style.

UPDATED: MAY 14, 2016 Hazy yellow pour, lively carbonation and a baby finger-sized head.  Smell of Wheat, lemon and some sour barnyard funk.  Fair bit more taste than smell here - Tart and Sour tasting, but in a good way.  Coriander, the label says orange peel but Im getting lemon and a bit of woodiness... you feel this one on the sides of your tongue.  Very refreshing - light bodied and not overly watery - Excellent Mouthfeel here.  Good stuff, though I suspect my bottle has sat for a bit - will revisit with a fresher bottle later in the summer.

Batch 279 consumed  april, 2011.   fresh, creamy, crisp wheat with a lemon, pepper twang and some pleasant grassy, earthy funk.   pleasant barnyard yeasty character.   refreshing.  crisp dry, wit, lactic sour, saison hybrid beer.  awesome.  refreshing.   light spiciness.   loved this.
Draught.  Pours cloudy orange with thick white head.  Aroma is lemon meringue and pear.  Light bodied,  lemony notes to the flavour.  Tart finish.
user_location: Munchen an der Willamette, Oregon, USA

text: I had this on tap at the pub in a sampler... This is one of their better beers apparently but in a sampler it just gets lost in the shuffle. A light lemony wheat beer, ginger there too. Its sour with wood but doesnt add anything to the beer. I wouldnt have this again.

Poured into a snifter. Pours a cloudy. straw yellow color, with some sediment making its way to the bottom of the glass. Strong head at first, then it dissipates quick after the first sip. Strong carbonation. Very sour aroma. I get a sour/sweet cherry aromas from this one. Sour flavors of the bat, I keep pulling the cherry aromas in the taste. Solid mouthfeel, with the carbonation hitting the back of teh mouth. the sour flavors invigorate my palate. This beer takes a few sips to get use to, but once you do, it is very enjoyable.

Bottle @ home. Hazy yellow orange body with a huge fluffy white head. Yeasty, citusy, somewhat spicy (coriander I think), and a sour Witbier nose. Mildly sour, yeasty, citrusy, light bodied wheat flavor. Slightly sour, light wheat finish. The wheat elements are pretty dull, partially dull to the sourness.

750 ml bottle from Wine and Cheese Place. Ive finally gotten around to buying some of these Jolly Pumpkin beers Ive been waiting on for no reason. Pours a hazy yellow color with a small, creamy, bone white head. Aroma of farmhouse funk, lemon citrus, white grapes, coriander, wheat, bready malts, and orange peel. Flavor of white grapes, coriander, orange peel, lemon citrus, wheat, bready malts, farmhouse funk, oak, and light spices. Medium-bodied, with medium but soft carbonation and a wheaty, just barely tart mouthfeel. Awesome take on the style. Could drink this all day.

Bottle from Village Pump shared by BrainLair.  For once a Jolly Pumpkin that didnt gush.  Still lots of nice carbonation in pale yellow pour, topped by a fluffy white head.  Spicy aroma. Lots of earthy yeasty funk.  Some lemon and citrus peel.  Bone dry with light spice.  Really light and refreshing.  Light tartness with lemon.  Very refreshing and easy to drink.

22oz bottle, batch 668.  Aroma is some wild yeast funkiness, lemon, vinegar,  some orange.  Pours a nice cloudy straw color with a massive white head that dissipates after a few minutes to an 1/8" layer, lots of thin lacing.  Flavor starts with wheat malt character, lemon, orange, coriander, and yeast.  Mildly tart flavor in the finish.  Very high carbonation, light body, and dry finish.  Nice refreshing brew.

12 oz bottle. 2008?  Not a huge fan of the style, but WOW, I enjoyed this one.  A nice, slightly hazy light straw pour with a gold highlighting.  Bone white head, slightly chunky lacing.  Aroma is citrusy with some nice yeast notes, perhaps a bit of floral and straw.   Some nice funk in the middle told me I was going to enjoy this.  A nice, well blended combination of citrus, acetic sour, barnyard funkiness, and subtle spices leads to a great flavor profile.  A bit of nice white fruit rounds things out.  Lively carbonation and a fairly smooth, dry mouthfeel.  Finishes a bit thin however, which is the only thing that I can really find wrong with this beer.  Fantastic, refreshing, and all around a pleasant surprise.

Thoroughly enjoyed from a 750ml bottle in a wine glass.  The beer pours a straw-colored yellow, with a fairly moderate white head.  The nose shows farmhouse funky brettanomyces notes, along with very pleasant notes of background citrus and spice.  A faint tart note also comes through.  The palate carries the beautiful bone dry character found in all Jolly Pumpkin beers.  Assertive carbonation and lemon greet the senses, before showing a subtle brett flavor.  The finish is crisp and dry.  Overall, a tremendous melange of aromas and flavors.  One of the best examples of the style, brett and all, Ive experienced.

(Sample Date: 12/31/2010   Source:Other)   Spicy orange zest with a light sourness in aroma. Peppery hop and yeast character. Clear light straw with huge white fluffy head. Earthy spicy flavor with a very light funk. Very light body with fizzy highly carbonated mouth feel. Very light funky citrusy sourness. Yum.

I shared this with LiteWait....Batch # 547 and bottle date of 5- 18-2010. Pored a hazy yellow with some floating sediment. A delightful aroma of citrus, coriander and light wheat. Lively carbonation and it dances nicely across your tongue. Orange peel and coriander are in the fore front. In mid-sip I get a light sweet tart. Very nice balance of citrus and tartness. On the finish you can pick up the Oak / wood barrel that makes it taste slightly like apple. Complex for a Wit. I wish we had more than 1 bottle. I would buy again.

Shared bottle with AirForceHops, Batch # 547 and bottle date of 5- 18-2010. Pored a hazy yellow with some floating sediment. A delightful aroma of citrus, coriander and light wheat. Lively carbonation and it dances nicely across your tongue. Orange peel and coriander are in the fore front.  In mid-sip I get a light sweet tart.  Very nice balance of citrus and tartness.  On the finish you can pick up the Oak / wood barrel that makes it taste slightly like apple.  Complex for a Wit.  I wish we had more than 1 bottle.  I would buy again.

From a 750ml into a snifter.  Pours with a ton of frothy white head which almost flows over the edge of the glass.  Aroma is fantastic!!!!  Very strong grass, funk and lemon all swirled together in perfect harmony (kumbaya)!  Mouthfeel is light and dry but too much carbonation takes away from it.  Taste is fairly similar to the aroma but with much more pronounced lemon.  Its actually a lot less intense than the aroma would let me to believe.  A very good beer and absolutely worth a try.  Im not sure Id purchase it very often given the price ($13), but Im glad I did.

Färgen är mycket ljus och skummet är ganska tunt.
Doften är inte alls vad jag väntade mig, utan består av lite spontanjäst syrlighet och en svag aning apelsiner.

Smaken är mycket spännande tycker jag.
Den är syrlig utan att vara sur, den har de typiske belgiska kulturämnen (ölen är en belgisk blond-typ öl), tydliga smaker av apelsiner och koriander.

Munkänslan är ganska len, men lite bubblig. Eftersmaken är en aning torr.
funky spicy barnyard aroma. hazy golden color. head doesnt last. carbonation is high. light bitter and sour. very light and refreshing. terrific.

Bottled. Ordered from erzbierschof.ch. Quick diminishing head. Fantastic bretty aroma. Extremely delicious with a huge amount of character. Yet another fantastic beer from Jolly Pumpkin to celebrate my rating number 2000.
Bottle, light golden straw color with a perfect head.  This beer is a fabulous  wit.  Just a tinge of sour.  Very drinkable and very refreshing.
Bottle:pours a hazy golden with a thick,fizzy head.notes of herbs, citrus and possibly some oak. Light bodied with a good amount of carbonation. Quite refreshing and a session beer.
Cloudy straw with a very dense white head.  Aroma is light with some coriander and lemon peel.  Flavor is lemony as well, with a firm hop bite on the middle and finish that continues through.
Yummy witbeer with Lemons and mint. The only weird thing is that it has an alka seltzer aftertaste

(12oz bottle) opaque yellow/gold with a ring and film of fine white bubbles. Nose of sour tangerine, wet charred oak, lightly funky, tart cherries, cinnamon and other spices, coriander and wheat. Taste of wheat, mildly tart with very minimal lactic acid but its there, reminds me of Jackie Os Orange Oak, tangerine, light vanilla, nice sweetness, tart cherries, a bit floral, really its awesome. Everything I love about a sour beer and wheat beers. Not too spicy, just a really nice integration. Soft carbonation, almost velvety fine. Delicious tart linger, some oak as well there. My ONLY complaint is a slight bit of saltiness (sodium bicarbonate) in the aftertaste, but honestly I could drink this all night long.
Sampled at MBGSF10 -  tart fruits, light and tasty. Fruity, raspberry, cherries. Creamy body. Wonderful funk and tart spiciness.

The aroma gives both the orange and coriander nicely. The appearance is awesome, golden almost yellow orange with a huge white creamy head. The flavor of a white ale to start with the sweet and spiciness, but then settles surprisingly with more tart than typical of this style, which makes it so delicious and rounds off the palate awesomely.

Bottle:Pours a Light Golden Color, Huge frothy stark white head into a weizen. Smell is really funky, some herbs and spices here. I was a little worried, to be honest. Thankfully after a few sips, you realize this is a fantastic belgian white. It starts off slightly funky from the.. well I dont know where it comes from. The Coriander? , bitter, and then you get the tartness from the orange peel, a little yeast and a little wheat here - its nice and smooth as well. Great brew.

Bottle. Murky yellow golden pour with a large foamy white head. Aroma is big time Brett, attic, pineapple, coriander, and some nice other spices. Flavor is attic, Brett, must, and orange. Nice dry finish. Excellent beer!
On tap at Hopcat, poured a pale hazy yellow color with a thin bubbly head, has a great aroma of banana with cloves, has a light sweet and sour finish, very intriging and enjoyable.
Tap. Yellow with thin bubbly white head. Slightly sweet yeast aroma. Flavor is tart yeast with a nice clean crisp finish. Very refreshing but enough flavor to keep me interested.

draft @ Paradiso, DC.
Pours cloudy golden, white head.
aroma, orange peel, light citrus with spices, with the unique JP touch.
flavors, aspect wit, with the JP twist, yeasty, light citrus, orange peel and coriander spices.
Finish keeps a mild bitterness with some orange peel along with a touch of wheat.

Bottle.  Aroma has notes of wheat, bread, sour dough and citrus.  Hazy yellow/orange hue with a smaller white foamy head that mostly diminished and left some lace.  Flavor is lightly sweet and bitter with a touch of sourness.  Palate is light bodied and refreshing with average carbonation.  Overall a refreshing citrus witbier that was was entirely satisfying.
Fresh, lemony beer, not too sour. Wheat malt in the background. This is not very complex, just a veru good version of a wit.

The 750 ml bottle pours hazed golden with a perfect white head.  The aroma is classic wit with the great JP tart nose coming through.  The flavor is exceptional, subtle sour notes, crisp, hints of citrus.  It really delivers but is clean and is a nice session beer.  It is definitely a base wit, but the JP sourness really makes this beer.  I will drink this all summer and all winter!
Had this one at the UDRBM, 31-07-2010. Golden colored brew. Aroma has oak, yeast. Flavor has wild yeast, citrus, some oak and sourness. Dry. Nice one.
Draft at Pizzeria Paradiso.  Very cloudy yellow.  Aroma of bubblegum and clove.  taste is very strong bubblegum, banana, cinnamon, with decent hops.  Very nice.

750 ml bottle shared by jsprime. pours hazed golden with a big fluffy white head. the aroma is classic wit with JP tartness. the flavour is as promised. the base wit is there but this beer is all about the JP magic. hella drinkable, id drink it all summer if i could. thx for the share jeff.

Sampled at Portland International Beerfest. Poured pale yellow with a small, quickly dissipating white head. Aroma is strong: orange peel, coriander, yeast, oak and some sour notes. Flavor is full of coriander and other spices, with a decided sour aspect and some light  oak. Incredibly unique tasting beer, excited to try more of Jolly Pumpkins stuff.

Bottle.  GBBF 10.  Hazy yellow gold with s thin white foam.  Aromas are lemon, spices and yeast with caremel, cream and wheat.  Flavours are sweet sweet with yeast and spices.  Fruity with sone acidity on the finish.  Good.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ 2010.  Vibrant golden beer with a light head.  The aroma is fruity and sour, and the flavour is very fruity.  Overall a nice beer.

Bottle @ meeting. Slight hazy golden pour, medium head.
Aroma of brett, spices, faint banana, some lemon.
Flavour is mildly sour of brett and lemon, furthermore some fruit and spices.
Very refreshing and highly drinkable.
Bottle, thanks to larsniclas. Hazy yellow color, white head. Citrus aroma, sourish, grapefruit and some milky notes. Sourish flavor with citrus. Sourish finish.

66cl Bottle at UDRBM. Hazy golden yellow colour, white head. Aroma of brett, sourness, green apples, lemon. Flavour is sour, lemon, funk, light sour/tart finish. Very lightbodied, even thin at times, but very refreshing. Ideal summer beer.

750 ml bottle poured into a tulip.  Color is a cloudy golden amber with a thin frothy white head.  Aroma is barnyard funk, citrus, coriander, and wheat.  Taste is sour and tart, with light sweetness.  Crisp medium mouthfeel with dry finish.  Quenching and tasty!

Bottle at Dutch RB Meeting. Slightly hazy golden pour, thin white head. Aroma of brett, coriander, sour apple, orange peel. Flavor is sour with loads of brett, some orange and citrus. Creamy texture and above average carbonation. Nice and refreshing.

0.75L bottle, kindly shared by larsga. Medium offwhite head. Slightly hazed, pale straw yellow body. Sharp citrus fruity aroma. A certain tartness, noticable coriander, and a whiff of horse stable and acetic acids. Acidulous and tart citrus flavor. Well spiced with a restrained wheaty crispness. Properly light-bodied. Astringent in the mouth. Bone dry finish. Quite a quencher.

UPDATED: JUN 23, 2012 Tap at Paradiso Dupont. Poured a full hazy light orange to deep yellow with a baby white head that left little lace. Aroma is insanely awesome funky sour ale: briney cheese, lactic sourness, white wine vinegar, lemon zest, horsey funk. Holy.... Taste is not sour, not really even tart. It is thin, malty, creamy, a bit powdery. Refreshing, light. Nose is the high point here as will almost all JP beers. 7/29/2010 8/4/6/3/14=3.5750mL 2012 ed. Pours cloudy peach with beautiful, pillowy, white head. Heavy retention and excellent lace. Huge clouds of foamy retention. Nose is excellent JP house funk, peach, Brett L, Brett C, pineapple, sour strawberry limeade. Taste is minerally, drained, not a lot of body, but super refreshing. Lemon juice. Palate is dry, minerally, fruity. Extremely light. Mild dough.
UPDATED: JUN 27, 2011 Draft. Pours hazy yellow with a white head. Flavor is soured witbier with notes of orange peel and corriander. A tad watery, but overall very good.

750ml bottle from Winooski.
Appearance :Clear pale yellow with a small creamy head.

Aroma : Nice citrusy tart and slightly barnyard. Some wheat. Really nice nose.

Taste : Tart, nice wheat. Some barnyard notes.

Overall : Not a lot of words but very good. Nice funkiness. Very refreshing and fresh. Exactly the beer that we needed in the middle of the tasting to cut thru all those big stouts and IPA. Very enjoyable.

Swift ($8): Pours a hazy pale yellow with a nicely sustained white head. Aroma is of citrus, spice, yeast, and wheat. Taste is sour. Indeed, it is quite sour for a witbier, but from what I understand, that is a hallmark of the brewery. Anyway, spice with Belgian yeast. Citrus flavors are complicated and multifarious. Quite a good brew. Very happy to have tried this.

Pours a hazy yellow with good bubbly texture and a big white creamy head. Smells wheaty and citrusy sour. Has a sour wheat taste and a dry mouthfeel. Lingers on the tongue with a flowery sour aftertaste. Very nice easy drinking white. Another great beer from JP.

A damn fine beer, I would drink it until my liver gave way. Nothing offensive at all, just beer bliss. Would get again fo sho. I was not expecting it to be so spiced and herbal, it was quite nice, not over herbed, just enough to play with the funky base beer, really one of the more well and thoughtfully orchestrated american wilds out there.

Bottle:  Pours a glistening pale yellow with lots of bubbles and a thin white head.  Aroma is dry and bready with yeast and florals.  Kinda dull and malty overall.  Tastes much better with a clean, crisp wheat and citrus flavor.  Some orange peel and light amounts of yeast.  A little lemon.  Very mild.

Medium white head. Hazy pale yellow body. Vinegary barnyard aroma with mealy apple and paper notes. Dry-acidic wheaty vinegary barnyard and flour taste with citric notes. Thinnish body. Mealy mouthfeel. Very dry mealy spicy apple aftertaste with vinegar and honey notes. Quite nice, and if you like this sort of thing it might even be very good. Delicate and balanced. (0.75l bottle, Systembolaget, Stockholm.)

Tap at Swift. Pours a hazy, pale yellow with a fizzy white head. Lightly bready and malty, the aroma also holds notes of citrus fruit, spices, yeast, wheat and slight barnyard funk. Flavor is modestly sweet, with more citrus and spice notes and faint hops. Medium bodied with lively carbonation. Finishes lightly hoppy and spicy. Very good stuff.

Tap @ Belmont Station during Puckerfest...  Poured hazy golden/yellow with a white head.  Funky nose with notes of wheat malts.  Tasted of bubblegum sweetness with a little bit of yeast tartness and an earthy tone.  Oaky, woodsy, and a tart fruit bitter quality.
Adonde taki y esta muy impresionantemente buena.  Belga pero no acida ni frutosa, mas bien seca

750 ml bottle, batch 298.  Pours with a huge white head, lots of carbonation.  Slightly cloudy golden yellow color.  Aroma is very pleasant, yeast, coriander, orange, vanilla, and some banana.  Excellent head retention.  Medium body, intially a sweet punch, quickly gives way to sour notes of lemon and yeast with a creamy mouthfeel.  A very nice long lasting and complex finish, sour and spicy.  Picked this up because it was on sale.  What a deal!

Batch #279

Appearance- The beer poured a hazy golden color with a nice medium white head that stuck around awhile. The lacing was present throughout the life of the beer.

Smell- Wonderful citrus aroma. Nice hints of orange and lemon zest. Nice barnyard funkiness with hints of spices and hops.

Taste- A nice grain taste with hints of orange, lemons, spices and a sour funkiness. Very clean and dry with a nice bitter finish.

Mouthfeel- Has a nice creamy mouthfeel with a medium high carbonation which gives it a nice crispness.

Overall- Another impressive beer from Jolly Pumpkin. This one isnt my favorite but is still a top notch, interesting brew. These beers make me want to try more wild ale beers!! Great stuff!

On tap at the Ann Arbor cafe.  Pours a hazy gold with a white head.  Aroma is a funky citrus tartness.  Flavor is similar, with the funky citrus tartness becoming very lemony with some light spices.  Clean finish.  I like this as kind of a "pure" example of the Jolly Pumpkin house flavor.

Pours a cloudy straw yellow with gorgeous floaties and a nice big white foam.  Aroma is orange and coriander.  Taste is nice wheat mouthfeel, coriander and orange.  Really nice relaxing warm day beer.
From a bottle,a pale yellow,tart,coriander,cherries ,this a great wit beer and will buy again.
Light yellow and hazy.Thick white head. Very tart. I taste the lemon and a little bit coriander in it . A pretty good sour beer.

Bottle 750ml. 

Aroma: Spices upfront, I mostly detect coriander. Some lemon peel and flowers. Theres also the usual JP funky (barnyard and hay) but less prononced than their others beers. Nice complexity, I was expecting more intense though. 

Taste: The lemon tartness is the main flavor. It makes it intense and refreshing while the yeasty notes round this one up nicely. I could also feel some bitterness (grapefruit skin) and sweetness (fieldberries).  
So well balanced. I didnt taste any oak though. 

Palate: Sprizty carbonation, champgne-like, makes it perfectly suitable for the style. The body is a little fuller than Id like though.

Probably the best witbeer Ive had. Balanced, complex, intense and refreshing. A little less acidic than the other JP Ive tried, which is a good thing.

(Bottled, 0.75l) Hazy, pale golden with a small, but lasting head and some lace. Slightly tart nose with wheat and spices - like part lambic, part witbier, but also nice fruitiness with sweet berries. Flavor is very fruity (grapefruit, apple, grapes), with pleasant brett tartness mixed with wheat-malty sourness. Almost medium body with quite high and foamy carbonation - still pretty refreshing. Jolly Pumpkin beers all seem to have the same kind of tartness, but this one it really suits well. A pleasant surprise, and a very nice and refreshing summer drink. 3254

UPDATED: FEB 2, 2013 Draft.  Poured hazy pale golden with a medium white head and quite a lot of lacing.  Aroma and flavor are moderately tart, rather acidic, some citrus and orange peel, a touch of spice. Mildly funky.  Delicious.

Bottled (thanks omhper!). Hazy yellowish golden colour. Medium white head. Aroma is sour and acidic along with wheat and yeast. Flavour is sour and slightly acidic wheat, yeast and spices. I could believe this actually was Belgian.

Bottled (BB 12/2011 batch 365)
Slightly hazy yellow color, small steady white head. Tart, citrusy, wheaty aroma. Crispy, foamy mouthfeel. Light palate. Bretta, citrus, coriander, orange peel. Refreshing and balanced light beer.

Calabaza Blanca Artisan White Ale--Ale Brewed With Spices--Batch #233, 234--2007-8	25.4 oz. Green Bottle.  4.80% ABV.  10 IBUs?  (4.0 / 5.0)  Foamy thin laced big white head.  Clear yellow color hazes lemon with flecks of light sediment.  Coriander orange lemon peel mild hop front.  Tangy crisp wheat spice orange lemon citrus mild fruit ester banana nutmeg body.  Tart clean refreshing spicy citrus end.  Sampled 2/7/2008.  $9.29 Each.

This one exploded on me upon opening. What was left poured hazy gold with heavily carbonated white head. Aroma is spicy fruits, orange peel and coriander spices. Taste is lemon tart with other fruits and wheat. Rated 9/3/08

nice one, but i definitely had the thought all the way through that this seemed to be a weird, low abv abbey tripel, same flavor with the brett, spice, coriandor, etc. really good beer that was extremely enjoyable. not what i expected for a white ale however. maybe not the best as a first foray into the wit genre, this is better if you have enjoyed a few wits or tripels.

(Bottle, 0.75 - batch #365 - from Systembolaget) Poured pale golden and hazy with medium sized, white and fizzy head. Aroma was fruity, sour, citric and mildly spicy - especially coriander. Palate was light bodied with quite high carbonation. Flavours were fruitiness, sourness, tartness, citricness and mild bitterness. Aftertaste was sour and fruity.
Pour from bottle.  Nice looking with big, white, frothy head and clear straw body.  Bready, coriander, clove, grassy aroma.  Slightly sweet, more acidic start with sour, dry finish.

Brown bottle, 1 pint 9,4 ounces, via Importations Privées Bièropholie (merci Hughes!), savoured on April 11 2010; eye: straw, lightly hazy, good effervescence, nice white head that turns into a sheet, light lacing; nose: yeast, bread, light coriander, light perfume, slight orange, light coriander; mouth: yeast, bread, light coriander, light perfume, wheat, light orange, finale in yeast with presence of perfume, medium body, good carbonation, light acidity, foamy texture; overall: fine

FRANÇAIS

Bouteille brune, 1 pinte 9,4 onces, via Importations Privées Bièropholie (merci Hughes!), savourée le 11 avril 2010; il : paille, légèrement voilée, bonne effervescence, belle mousse blanche qui se transforme en une petite couverture, très légère dentelle; nez : levure, pain, léger coriandre, léger parfum, très léger orange, léger coriandre; bouche : levure, pain, léger coriandre, léger parfum, froment, léger orange, finale en levure avec présence de parfum, corps moyen, bonne carbonatation, légère acidité, texture mousseuse; en résumé : bien

(bottle - 750 ml)  Hazy gold pour with a thick and frothy white head. Aroma is tart and funky with a nice amount of Brett and some mild wheat and spice. Flavor is tart and Bretty at the start with a dry and lightly grainy wheat middle. Finishes tangy and funky with a very lightly spiced hint. Sour flavor lingers for a while.

750mL into german heff glass. Pours a light straw yellow with a bit of a haze. Huge white head on this one with excellent head retention. Smells of sour musky lemon on the nose. . Mouthfeel is zesty yet ends very soft and gentle. Flavor is smooth and easy going as well. Malt profile is medium, spice flavor is minimal and finishes with with a slight tartness to it. Excellent brew from JP

Bottle. Pour was light hazy golden with a hue of orange. Aroma was crisp with orange, coriander, some lemon, and a bit of funkiness. The lemon came out a bit more in the flavor along with a little lactic character that was quite pleasant. Very well blended brew with full flavor and a light body. Very nice!

Strong coriander, clove, and baby food aroma, a bit rubbery.It foamed out of the bottle upon opening. Hazy yellow, efferevescent, thick white lacing head. Tan flakes dance on the bubbles. Pleasantly tart lemon flavor, light coriander. Very enjoyable, quaffable, but otherwise unremarkable. Perhaps I l shouldnt look for much else from this narrow style.
Batch 285 Pours golden with a white head. Aroma is sour apple, citrus,  and funk. Flavor is sour, light citrus, with a dry tart finish. Very one dimensional.

A very cool wit beer here. First impression i got about the color was that it reminded me of a cloudy sparkling wine in hue. A very mild yellow beer with a fluffy head at the top. the aroma was coriander and a lemon orange element. There was also a yeast aroma which was a bit like rubber but this was subtle and gave a certain funk that added to the aromas. A pretty tart taste that smacks of lemon and ends with just a bit of yeast. The carbonation is super fine, once again reminding me of champagne.
cloudy pour; orange, coriander are present but subtle; certainly brings the funk, something often missing from lesser Belgian wheats

Appearance: Very pale gold color, almost yellow. A bit of yeast cloudiness which fits the style. Large creamy head that lasts a while.

Aroma: Very light and citrus-y, a bit of a sour twang that I really enjoy but seems to dominate the senses.

Taste: A little sour but perfectly balanced with a clean, tart aftertaste. Tastes a bit like cider but has a great brett taste that I loved. No hop character at all.

Palate: Pretty thin but very intensely carbonated, finishes clean with a nice tart pucker.

Overall: Hands down my favorite wit (my favorite style mind you!) and definitely in my top 5. Its a fantastic tasting beer and stands out among every other wit Ive tried, but like most wits it doesnt hold your interest for more than a glass or so.

750 ml. bottle. Batch 298. Pours a thick, fluffy, tiny bubbled, long lasting white head, with extensive lacing, over a slightly cloudy, yellow (SRM 3) body....nose is light coriander, slight citrus, cereal, biscuit, bit of barnyard funk, and very light floral overtones.....taste initially is slightly tart then light lemon/orange leading to typical Belgian barnyard funk, quite dry throughout....mouth feel is light to medium, carbonation adds to a light sensation. This meets  the descriptors of the style quite well. BJCP 8/3/15/4/7

Tasted from a 12 ounce bottle.

Aroma - Yeasty, green apple, under ripe white grape, moist aged leather and citrus.

Appearance - The beer has a pale golden color, and it is slightly cloudy.  The large fluffy head dissipated quickly.

Taste - The predominant flavor is sour apple.  The sour white grape flavor comes through as well.  Just a small amount of bitterness.

Palate - The body is very light with an oily texture.  The carbonation is lively and the finish is short, but sour and acidic.

Overall - This is a great example of what this style should represent.  It is fairly simple but very enjoyable.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Lemon, apple, yeast, light brett, leather. Yellow, no head, looks like a cider. Medium sweet, tart, leather, light woody, lemon, acid. Bit thinnish. Great flavours, very interesting stuff. Like an easy geuze.

0.75 l bottle from Systembolaget. Hazy golden color. Dry, tart, spicy, horsey and lemony aroma with pepper, clove and grapefruit. Dry, tart, grapefruity and spicy flavor with pepper and coriander. Oily mouthfeel. Rich taste and good drinkability. Nice balance of wild yeast character and witbier spices.

Hazy light orange color. Smells sour, funky, and like a lake. I dont know. Thats what I wrote down. Its been awhile. Tastes sour and tart. Reminds me of a urinal cake. Easy drinking for the style though. Gets better the more you have. Initial impression sucks, but its grows on you. Some very balanced qualities.

750 ml bottle. A bit dim, golden body with a big white head. Aroma has Bret, wheat, spices and yeast. Flavor is acidic, fruity and some kind of bitterness different to hop bitter. A very nice, a bit unusually and relatively quaffable beer.

750 ml bottle. A hazy pale golden beer with a large, creamy and mostly lasting white head. The aroma is really nice and powerful, lightly malty, lightly hoppy, moderately yeasty, with notes of barnyard, flowers, lemon, orange, wheat, coriander and other spices. The flavour is moderately sweet, moderately acidic, lightly bitter. Flavourful and funky. Light to medium body, lively to fizzy carbonation, average lenght finish with light to medium bitterness. Spectacular aroma and nice flavour balance, perhaps too watery, but another winner from this brewery.

Sour aroma above all else, reminds me of my visits to a vineyard. Appearance as a Wit should be, pale and hazy. A light head of foam. Taste was tart and sour. Light Palate. Overall, a light but sophisticated sour beer.

750ml bottle at Barrica in San Juan, PR. Cloudy ochre color with foamy white head; foamy head, though not long lasting. Citrus aroma, yeasty. Strong sour flavor, citrusy lemons, quite tart. Slight aftertaste, lingers.
Batch 318/319.  Darkish yellow, lumpy white head.  Apple aroma, tart, dry.  Taste is dry, fruity, dry cider, light sourness, apple sweetness, oak.

Pours a cloudy, effervescent straw color with a huge rocky white head.  Aroma is very funky, lots of citrus and spice.  Flavor is citrusy, spicy, slightly tart, and very dry.  Palate is light, and there is just way too much carbonation.  Eh.

from crackedkettle.com - pale and slightly hazy blond colour with a white and firm persistent foam; aroma of citrus and bretts; initially creamy palate but soon sourish and tart, quite thin-bodied, quite dry and citrusy sourish aftertaste - very drinkable and delicate

When it comes to Belgian Whites, I get jolly over this Jolly Pumpkin. Being as I began my beer tasting world on witbiers, I have grown to truly love them. And this one takes the cake. Its combination of orange, coriander, and sour fruits mixes to make a memorable beer.
Excellent Wit! Notes of wheat, brett and oak. Flavor is an excellent dry Wit flavor. The flavor is a nice tart brett flavor with dry notes - not unlike eating dry cheese.

batch 304/305  pleasantly sour aroma, apricot, dried fruit  bright yellow-golden appearance with a light foamy head.  smooth and highly carbonated dry champagne on the the palate  Overall, an absolutely delicious, special beer.

Hazy orange with a medium-sized head. Good lacings.

The smell is of wheat, oranges, spices, hints of tobacco and brett. Good, rather mellow. Good balance.

The taste is somewhat sweet with dry wheaty flavors and dry orange notes. Spices (mostly coriander) and mild bretty notes. Very tasty juicy fruit flavors, mostly tart citric notes. Hints of yeast. The finish is dry with note of wheat, fruits and minerals.

Moderate body, rather dry texture. Nicely refreshing carbonation.

A good beer. Very easy to drink. Im not usually a big fan of witbiers, but this one was rather pleasant.

Serving type: bottle

(Copy of old Beer Advocate review)
Superb White. Hazy highly carbonated pale yellow ale. Very citrus nose. Bubbles that stay alive with orange taste
Short fluffy white head over a clowdy yellow beer. Spicy aroma with a litle orange and white pepper. Tart taste and dry finnish.

(bottle)  From the aroma, I knew this was not a traditional witbier.  The aroma was waaaaaayyyy too sour to be considered a wit.  Sure enough, the flavor followed suit.  I admit I do not like sour beers and this was just too much.  Not enough yeast or spice.  The sourness just overpowers everything.  This is my first Jolly Pumpkin and Im highly disappointed.

Bottle.  Pours a hazy gold with a large creamy white head.  Wheat, funk, yeast, and a tad papery.  Crisp brett flavor, dry, lemony.  Finishes with a bit of the musky coriander I was hoping for on the nose, and a bit of crisp light acid.  Really tasty stuff.
Sour on the palate, with golden malts and funky citrus. Lots of sour fruit here lingers.
Pours cloduy yellow/gold with a sudsy white head. Aroma is Belgian yeast, wheat, and tart lemon. Taste is slightly sour with vinegar and sweet candy.

Batch 298 Bottle.  Clear liively straw pour whit a frothy white head.  Aroma is fresh, crisp, yeast and spice,  Flavour is suprisingly funky and sour.  Lemony and some subtle spice, coriander comes across.  Dry finish with a sour linger.
From a bottle poured a hazy golden color with a fair amount of head.  Nice light citrus spice flavor with a quick finish.

sample from the bottle at The 2009 Great Decatur Beer Festival on 10/17/09...  pours a clear golden with a nice white head... I can imagine this looking great in a full pour.  funky tart aroma with some citrus on the nose... light to medium body with soft sides... some yeast, wheat and orange throughout... nice light sour finish.  very well made.
Bottle. yellow colour with a white head. Aroma is citrus, brettish. Flavour is citrus, brettish, spices, orange. Medium body. Nice beer.

75 cl bottle ,batch #285.Cloudy yellow with a big white head.Very nice "Gout d Orval"  aroma ,spicy and bitter,urinal and fruity.The flavor is lovely spiced and sour ,with funk and tartness.I think this is the start of a long friendship .Lovely.
Cloudy golden orange with a nice white fluffy head. Aroma is orange lemon sour with a touch of spice. Flavor is like a sour orange juice. Bubbly light and refreshing finish. Very good.

Bottle. Pours a cloudy medium yellow with a huge, dense creamy head.
Aroma is initially spicy, some orange zest and acidic, yeast and dusty brett funk. 
Flavour is surprisingly sour. The sourness feels fresh and comes through all the way here. Some definite yeast and funk tones also contribute to the flavour, with a vaguer spicyness underneath. The wheat characteristics are nearly all gone. 
A refreshing and sparkly carbonation makes it easy to drink. Overall a good, refreshing beer with some surprising takes on a style thats usually a tad boring.

UPDATED: DEC 28, 2009 Bottle, 75cl. A hazy, yellowish beer with a creamy, white head sitting on top. Citrusy, bretty nose, leaving most other scents in oblivion. Still, I really appreciate it. The flavor has a nice sourness, citrusy and a tad milky, with a citrus-peel bitterness coming strong towards the finish. And it stays for a good while too, the bitterness. Medium body, very effervescent. A quite lovely one. Rating: 7-4-7-4-15-3.7. 090720Bottle, 22oz. Its a clear, golden beer with a rocky off-white head leaving lacings. Citrusy-sour, grainy nose, rather funky. Citrusy flavor with grains, a fine bitterness and pleasant barnyard-ish and leathery flavor. Effervescent, medium body, tart. Citrus peel-like bitterness in the finish, with pale malts blending nicely in. A really fine beer. 090828

Bottle. Split this brew with James and Dallas. Pours hazy, murky golden with a frothy white head. Aroma of spice, citrus, and hops. Full, crisp body with a tart, bitter finish. Excellent witbier; best Ive tasted so far.

Location: Draft at Jimmys 43, 9/14/09


Aroma: Classic citrus & spice nose of a Belgian white, but with a good amount of barnyard funkiness

Appearance: Hazy golden color with a bright white and kind of foamy head

Flavor: Nice sweet and tart flavors mixed in there, some funk, some spice, pretty tasty

Palate: This beer is rather fizzy, but without taking much away from a very nice mouthfeel

Overall Impression:
I found this one to be quite interesting.  I figured Id give this a shot when I saw it, and Im glad I did.  Even though Im not a huge fan of Belgian Whites in general, I surely found this one to be a really enjoyable beer, though at its price point, I probably wont drink it all that regularly, I will certainly enjoy it again in the future.

Big foamy white head tops a cloudy yellow beer.  "JP funk": yeast and woody aroma along with a tinge of sourness in aroma.  Light and refreshing with a pleasant sourness.  Bubbly mouthfeel with grapes and sasparilla in flavor.

1pt9.4oz bottle.  Pours hazy yellow with a moderate foamy white head.  Smells of grapefruit and spices.  Tastes citrusy, like orange and some coriander, wheat, and a very sour/tangy aftertaste.  Very nice beer.

Bright yellow with a thin white head. The nose is full, tart and the taste is sour goodness with a little fruitiness, God I wish I hadnt burned my tongue on some soup earlier in the day. This is the best wit beer I have ever had and another winner from Jolly Pumpkin. Mouthfeel is bubbly and enjoyable. Jolly Pumpkin beers are not cheap but you definitely get what you pay for and I love the funkiness.

Serving type: bottle
Pours a clear golden with white head. Aroma of tart, yeast, citrus, spice.  Similar taste.  Very carbonated.  Well balanced.

Bottle 318/319 shared with the guys at the Inglorious Emergency Tasting. Pours a near clear light golden straw with good white head.  Nose is barnyard and socks.  Flavor is white pepper, lemony, good sour.  Balance.  Great large carboantion is like champagne and cuts the acidity perfectly. Good beer.
Pours a fading white head with a golden body.  Aromas of funk, yeast, clove, zest.  Flavor is banana, dough, clove, zest, fennel, and sour.  Nice carbonation.

6/7/2009......Cloudy golden with orange tinges...creamy fluffy white head ((there was a ton of it in the bottle, i didnt think it was going to stop))...spices and orange in the nose...clove and coriander--a nice mix ....delicate malts also......a rush of orange in the 1st sip, light yet a nice backbone....extremely refreshing..its zingy and goes well with "enjoying the day ladies".....a touch of sediment in the base of my glass....Flemish-esque---thanks for the share Kawabomber  :)

Pours a pale hazy yellow with soft orange highlights. Billowy sticky white head. The nose is tart and yeasty, notes of lemongrass and oak, mildly spicy, fruity, estery.  Flavor is tart and spicy, citrus rind character, oaky bite, mild yeasty funk. Palate shows a citrus rind bite with a yeasty tartness and spicy oak character. JP kicks ass
Golden bodied wit with citrus, coriander and a bit too much coriander for my palate.   Light, refreshing, definitely a lawnmower beer.

UPDATED: OCT 7, 2014 this beer had the common denominator-tart funkiness-that ive come to expect from a JP brew, but thats where the accolades end.  this was actually my first disappointment from them, a thoroughly one dimensional beer.  all funky tart, and virtually no wit character to speak of.  it may as well have been an artisan lager...none of the 3 of us tasting could have told it was supposed to be a wit had the label not said.  not a bad beer in any way, but im surprised its rated so high within the style.  maybe there is consistency issues, but the one we drank had a barely detectable (only when the thin sediment was poured) coriander/orange peel flavor, and none in the aroma.

Bottle, pours cloudy dark gold with a thick, firm off-white head. Aroma of orange peel, lemons, spice. Light body and powerful carbonation. Theres a little bread, lemon and funk in the taste, but its mostly orange peel and coriander. Dry, spicy and somewhat floral finish.

On tap at Sugar Maple.  Golden yellow with a moderate sized white head that fades away quickly.  Aroma of yeast, toasted malt, mild fruit peel and mild sourness with a dash of citrus for good measure.  Taste pretty much follows the aroma, probably the least sour or barrel-esque of the beers Ive had from the jubilant squash.  Light and went down easy but otherwise just okay.

Bottled from Systembolaget
Hazy golden with a medium, white head.
Really sour citric aroma.
Buttery with lactic acid.
Fruity citrus and spiciness as well.
Bottle, clear pale yellow color, stingy small bubbled white head. Lightly sour aroma with notes of the coriander. Taste is tart belgian white flavors with a wine like finish.

Bottle - What can I say? Jolly Pumpkin does it for me. Pours a light yellow with a huge white head. Smells of orange, lemon, and sour funk. Taste is sour apple, oak, and dry citrus. Its smooth, effervescnt, and has a dry finish without much aftertaste. Just refreshing as hell. I have four more JP brews in my cellar, and cant wait to tackle them all.

Bottled, batch 365: Pours hazy golden with a creamy head. Sourish lemon aroma. Sourish grapefruit, lemon and coriander flavour, there might even be a touch of brett. IMHO theres just a little bit too much coriander.

Pours clear golden, hazy towards the bottom of the bottle, with a puffy white one-and-a-half finger head, good lacing.  Aroma of lemon, crackers, and spice.  Medium body, tart and crisp.  Strong coriander and citrus, with some grapefruit, spice and biscuit, with a mild, but long wheat and citrus finish.  Well balanced.

UPDATED: FEB 2, 2013 First rating75 cl bottle thanks to deft!BB Dec 2011, batch 365Sampled on July 14, 2009Hazy pale golden color, medium white head. Grassy, herbal, hoppy, acidic scent. Acidic, hoppy, lemon taste. Almost mouthpuckering sour mouthfeel, low bitterness.6/3/6/3/12=3.0RerateBottle from Matt / Nekrobarr (non on ratebeer). Sampled on January 27, 2013. Bottle marked Batch 1155 Bottled 08-23-2012.Hazy yellow honey color, white fluffy head. Sweet, fruity, light acidic scent. Spicy, apple, tart scent. Medium mouthfeel, low bitterness. Tart finish.7/4/6/3/12=3.2

75 cl bottle at my garage-tasting 8th. May. Hazy golden color, white head. Aroma is fruity with sourness. Flavor is a bit sour, yeast, spice and fruit. Very interesting beer, as always from Jolly Pumpkin.

Tap at Ashleys. Poured a cloudy gold with a white head. Aroma was very citrusy with lemon and grapefruit notes. A sweet flavor with plenty of fruit notes, grapefruit, orange and lemon among others. Nice for a Witbier.

Bottle. Cloudy yellow colour with a white head. Aroma: light sourness and brett, coriander, pepper, wheat, lemon. Flavor: Lightly sour, lightly bretty, wheat, lemon, wood, light spiciness. Dry finish.

Bottle sample at Muckfest 2009 Day 2.  Cloudy gold color with a huge white head.  Lots of spice in the nose with some sweet malt and a bit of sourness.  Tart flavor with spices, a bit of hop and a tart finish.

Bottle.

Pours pale golden with a white head.

Dry saison type of aroma.

Fruity and grape taste.

UPDATED: MAY 8, 2015 Bottle. Ap: Pours yellow with a white head. Ar: Citrus sourness, some spices and vanilla. Fla: CItrus sourness, small spiceiness. Ov: Really good and refreshing belgian wit. I enjoy the saison-like sourness. Miss some complexity and depth.

Bottle batch 382/383. Pours with a cloudy, glowing golden body and a creamy white head that leaves good lace. Really a good looking beer. Aroma of cracked pepper, star anise, grains of paradise, tart lemon, coriander and orange peel. Taste is initially bitter with orange peel up front and some tartness, but not nearly as strong as other Jolly Pumpkin beers can be. I think this is the lightest I have had. Super drinkable with a coriander finish. Medium carbonation that finishes dry. Nice summer beer, but not as good as some of the other JP masterpieces, which I will re-rate tomorrow night with m4rest88.

Pours hazy gold, thick rocky head.  Aroma of hay, spices, banana, bubblegum?  Nice understated flavor, with some spiciness and sourness at the end. Thinnish, not very carbonated despite the rocky head.  Nice beer in one of my favorite styles.

UPDATED: OCT 18, 2009 On cask at RNH (Midtown, NYC): Pours a hazy yellow tone and the aroma is potent of orange/lemon citrus. Tastes like free green tea found at Japanese restaurants. Very smooth finish. Light on the tounge and easily drinkable. Its okay- the uniqueness of this beer makes it memorable in a good way. #046 on 03072009, DG.

From a cask at RattlenHum.  Cloudy pour.  Unusually tangy and herbal flavor, almost like a cider or a kvas (or kwas, or kombucha, which I make at home btw) mixed with hefeweizen.  It reminds me as much of a health drink or a tea as a wit beer.  Flavor of sour lemon, smoke, and herbs.  Like the other Jolly Pumpkins I have tried, it tastes handmade.  An interesting change of pace brew.
Bottled. Cloudy golden. lactic nose. Sweetish and light bodied. Orange and vanilla withtart yeasty acidic flavours. Juicy and refreshing, surprisingly complex for a wit. Good and unusual.

UPDATED: JUN 12, 2010 On cask at Spuyten Duyvil. Golden pour. east choice creates almost a lambic or sour beer flavor. Aroma is of orange peel. Nice beer. Need to try bottled version. Bottled version is funky with some yeast and citrus tones, almost like a wit berliner weiss.

Bottle, batch 365. Pours a hazy light yellow colour with a white to ivory white frothy head. The aroma is wheaty with obvious notes of wood, light funk, sourish lemon and orange and some light yeasty and soapy notes. The flavour is wooden dry with some light funk, wood and tart wheat, citrus and orange. Just a hint of yeasty sweetness. You can feel a small spicy note together with the bone dry notes of wood in the aftertaste. All hail to the pumpkin!

UPDATED: JUN 29, 2009 ***Also sampled on cask @ RattlenHum: still nice, but much better in bottle***

Batch 313:  This beer is underrated! (and I always underrate, but this one is a keeper!)  Pours a hazy light honey, leaving a white, medium dry head with fragile and shortliving lacing.  The aroma immediately identifies itself as Witbier, bitter, sugary, citrus fruits poking you in the nostrils.  The taste reveals more lemons than I expected, but nicely balanced with the spices and sugars, cleaned up evenly with the medium carbonation.  A very refreshing, clean and defrickinlicious brew!

Ditto on BeerBaron617...He had the sips from my beer - I think I lucked out and got the better beer when we were at Ashleys.  

Never the less...This beer was amazing.  My first of the Jolly Pumpkin ales, and I am so excited that I bought four more bottles at the brewery.  I got this on tap and it came to the table with virtually no head at all but it was a nice hazy yellow color.  Aroma was all there, and the flavor was amazing!  A bit sour, and certainly not what I expect from a Belgian white.  Awesome craft beverage!

I shared a few sips of this on tap at Ashleys in Ann Arbor, ironically enough it was on our way back from the actual brewery, which we stopped at to pick up a few bottles, which its just outside of Ann Arbor. It poured a hazy light yellow, with no head, but it seemed the bartender was at fault. The aroma was subtle, but the flavor was far from it. It was nice and slightly sour, with a great finish. Cheers to Ron and everyone at Jolly Pumpkin for the friendly words, and very well crafted ales!

Tap @ Spuyten Duyvil - what a great beer this was.  Pours a cloudy straw color with a fluffy white head that left plenty of lacing on the inside of the glass.  The aroma is citrus, coriander, clove, and a bit of Belgian yeast.  Aroma is the same, with the citrus and spices melding together to form a sublime and surprisingly complex drinking experience.  I think this was a great witbier and really well done by these guys.
Pours cloudy straw with huge fluffy white head that descends with plenty of lacing.  Classic citrus and spice flavors with strong hint of sourness.  A must for Hoegaarden fans.

Bottled. Pours out in a hazy pale golden colour with a rich frothy white foam. Tart aroma of lemon, wood, orange-peels and mild pepper with yeasty undertones of green banana and coconut. Fairly light-bodied with notes of tart lemon, leaves, vanilla, yeast and oak. Lemony finish with touches of oak, coconut and yeast.

750 mL bottle from Sams Quik Shop (Batch 285; brewed 2/29/08, to oak 3/5/08, bottled 4/2/08).  VERY carbonated and this one did gush just a bit (but not nearly as much as the 3 bottles of Oro de Calabaza Ive had).  Light, pale yellow in color with a very fluffy white head.  The swirl at the end of the bottle finally gives this the cloudy, Witbier look.  Pleasant, citrusy sour aroma.  Even with Jolly Pumpkin the sourness was a great surprise.  After the aroma the fact that this has a tart taste is no longer a surprise but it is very welcome.  The finish is clean and refreshing.  I think this is totally misclassified as a Witbier but as a beer it is fantastic.

Batch 279.

Appearance: Pours out a cloudy, straw-colored body with a frothy, tall, white head.

Smell: Pleasant mixture of tangy wheat with tart-scented fruits, earthy, freshly-ground spices, piquant oak, and some punchy lactic notes.

Taste: Soft white wheat with a scant, brief honey-like sweetness. Tart fruity flavors of pears, white peaches, and, lastly, some tastes of sweet and bitter orange peel. Then, in comes the spice hints of coriander and powdered ginger. Relatively smooth, but still slightly puckering oak wood hints. Theres sort of a ubiquitous lactic sourness throughout. Finishes rather dry with lingering, lasting touches of oak, spice, and tartness.

Mouthfeel: Its just a hair under medium-bodied. Well carbonated, no question there, and quite bubbly from beginning to end.

Drinkability: To help "set the mood" for this beer, I stepped out into the unpleasant, grotesquely humid, hot Atlanta weather for a few minutes. Though it ultimately lacked the body and creaminess of some witbiers, I felt it excelled surprisingly well in terms of both refreshment and enjoyment (at least with Batch 279). With some beers, clearing through a mere twelve ounces is a chore, but finding the end of this 750ml was a breeze!

750mL Bottle: Slightly cloudy gold topped w/ a small white head, bubbles dance throughout. Citrus, coriander & yeast in the aroma. Nice wheat tartness, citrus (lemon/orange) & spices. Tart & dry w/ perfect carbonation. I can see myself killing many a bottle of this, delicious!!

gunshot crack poured to hoegaarden tumbler. appearance is sunshine yellow with well clouded structure. flavor is bracingly tart, bordering on sour. nose of strong yeast notes but without outright funk. citrus fruits come and go but grapefruit -- probably due to the bitterness -- lingers. dry, refreshing and interesting.

Hazy gold pour.  Fluffy off white head and spotty lace.  Orange and coriander aroma.  Lightly tart with atypical wit flavors.  I never thought I was really going to like this one, but i did! Another excellent beer from JP
Some barnyard with ginger ale in the nose.  Cloudy off-white with black floaties.  Very tart and crisp, some sourness and lots of white wine flavor.  Rather frothy.  Not too bad,

Pours a cloudy yellow/golden with a huge soapy head that lasts for minutes. Aroma is sour with hints of sweet oranges. In the mouth its quite bitter and dry, a little watery and unsurprisingly quite carbonated
Pours a hazy gold. Light spice nose, some barnyard funk. Perfectly tart with some of the classic wit flavors lingering.

750ml bottle... pours a ginger ale color, with a descent head that lingers smells of tart melon and fruits with a taste that is similar... very light and refreshing, i found the finsih to be quite sweet

UPDATED: JUN 1, 2009 Bottle pour.Smells like a grapefruit/orange,citrusy with a funk to it and a slight wheat smell.Light orange/golden color.Very smooth,wheat doesnt kill any of the other flavors,good tart finish.I liked this and want to try some of the other Jolly Pumpkins.

Bottle shared by MiguelMandingo.  Thanks!  Pours semi hazy golden with short lived white head.  Smell is tart, funky, sour and wheaty.  Taste is smooth and wheaty with a dry, tart finish.  Lightly oaky and enjoyable.  Smells funky, tart and tastes like a wit, though.  Nice.

Bottle.  A intro to funky beers would describe this one.  It has the typical funky, yeasty aroma of a JP beer.  Flavor is a bit funky and a little tart, but not sour.  Flavor is quite refreshing and has some underlying yeast, leather and wet earth flavors.  Easy to drink.  First JP beer I have had that I could drink 2 or more of in one sitting.

Crushed with Jakebra.  Agreed with Honkeybra on this one.  About as sit-back-and-drinkable as any beer.  Excellent sour funk in every aspect of this brew.  JPs are all starting to taste the same to me, but theyre still all pretty damn funky-awesome.

Batch 298 750 mL bottle from Bruisin Ales. Pours a clear golden yellow with a large head. Of course the end of the bottle provides lots of yeasty particles. Great head retention and lacing. Very fruity and slightly funky aroma with notes of candied citrus, apple, pear, caramel. Taste is also very fruity with lemon, orange, cherry, spice and a slight tart funkiness. Smooth, slightly syrupy and full bodied.

Bomber. Even with a slow pour, theres as much head as there is beer, which slowly fades to a nice half inch of thick foam. Initially lightly cloudy, settles to mostly clear. Light straw color. Big yeasty smell, quite sour, some nice funk. This is definitely pushing the farmhouse flavors. Nice funkiness, and that same one of a kind taste that Jolly Pumpkin has. This tastes to me like "Jolly Pumpkin," meaning all their beers have the same underlying flavor, and with this one not as strong with the other malty or hoppy flavors, that house character shines.

Wow, I finally see the attraction of this brewery! This was really tasty. Hazy lemon yellow liquid with puffy white foam. Pillowy wheatiness, but very dry with lots of delicious lemony, peppery brett. but in a very restrained way, and none of the weirdness and astringency some of their other beers have had. Very light-bodied but still quite firm. Tastes a lot like wheat, but none of the other classic witbier flavours at all - not that they are needed. Drank this out in the sun on a warm morning and it disappeared way too quickly. Very impressive stuff. (Also tried an Oro de Calabaza a while back which was a lot better than my old rating, but not as good as this.)

Pours a light straw color with a thick, foamy head. Aroma is like an old dusty house, with a bit of potpourri, perfume  green apples and some lavender. Lots of carbonation. Taste is identical to the aroma with surprise, a tart finish. I probably paired it with the wrong food, Ill try on its own and review again.

Pours a slight head with a hazy golden color to the body. Strong nose with the Jolly Pumpkin standard tartness. Taste delivers the same tartness with a slight citrus tint. very light on the wheat taste. A fairly high amount of carbonation gives it a nice pop on the palate.
Bright golden yellow and cloudy with a good sized white head. Aroma is tart with some grain and orange peel. Taste is of coriander orange peel, and yeast. Tart and refreshing.

12oz bottle, not sure of the age.  Nice big nose of spices up front follow by a greatly refreshing taste with a little bit of funk.  Nice and soft orange peel throughout with a super dry finish, you could barely tell you drank it at all.  I could drink this thing all summer.

Dammit this is a good wit., I had a glass of this after about four cantillons and some Orval a few months ago and I knew for damn sure that my palate couldnt pick up the beauty of this beer at the time so I didnt rate it. Tontie I absolutely get it, and it is f-king gorgeous. Pours a hazy light hay color with plenty of floaties and a nice withe head, without much lace. The Aroma is just beautiful Funky and floral, just enough horse blanket to really tease the palate into really really wanting to drink the beer. The Flavor is immediately spicy and fruity with a gorgeous dry funky character. For those who are looking for a wit that they can stand this is highly recommended.

UPDATED: SEP 10, 2009 Pours a golden color with a fluffy white head. Very pleasant aroma here, nice blend of flowers, spices, yeast and malt. This is very light and soft, fruity flavors with a bit of oak and a dusty, dry finish. Quite a bit of carbonation, or a seltzer-like feel. This isnt great but overall I liked it. Reminds me a little of a nice light dry white wine.  Re-rate 9/10/09.  Bottle from Knightly.  Golden colored, a fizzy white head with a nice layer staying on top.  The aroma is nice, chardonnay, brett, coriander, lemon, flowers.  Spices mix with coriander fruity flavors and a touch of oak.  Finishes very dry and a touch bland.  Light, refreshing but still with some complexity.
Nice, refreshing, slightly sour and lactic wit beer. Slight spiciness up front, a little funky, and really refreshing overall.

Brewed in the USA...... Courtesy of AFI96, thanks waylo !!!  Pours a hazy yellow color with a lasting white head. Aroma of barn yard funk, citrus, yeast and malts. Taste is much of the same, but has some faint spices throughout. The mouthfeel is very spritzy and refreshing. Overall, I am not a big fan of Witbier styles, but this one is my favorite so far.

12oz bottle shared with BeerGestapo. Hazy light gold topped by a small but lasting head. The nose is tart and yeasty, a bit of citrus layered over funk. The taste is similar but after my tastebuds got acclimated to the tart funkiness I picked up a smooth wheaty character as well. The mouthfeel was excellent, very lively carbonation. I havent been a huge fan of the Witbier style in the past but maybe all it needed was a blast of Brettanomyces to make it more palatable.
A good brew.  This is some nice artisan style white.  Bottle conditioned and you can taste every little bit.

Cloudy white pour with a thick white head. Funky, sour, yeasty aroma with a bit of wheat. Flavor is ctirus and wheat with a sour, funky finish.  Id been thinking about this for a while, and it did not disappoint. This is the kind of beer you can sit and drink and enjoy for a while.
Hazy straw color with substantial white head.  Aroma is citrus, yeast, malt, and funk.  Taste is really tart and lemony plus yeast and a little malt.  Medium body and carbonation.

50cl bottle.  Pours a hazy yellow colour with a big fluffy white head and sticky lacing.  Aroma is big citrus plus some yeast.  The flavour is more citrus, more yeast and little sour funk in the finish. Interesting take on the witbier style and definitely not average.

Bottle 75cl.[ Batch 285 ]. Clear medium yellow color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white to off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, moderate hoppy, citrus, orange, moderate to heavy yeasty, barnyard, spicy, coriander notes. Flavor is moderate to light heavy sweet, moderate acidic and bitter with a average to long duration. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20081028]
Pours a murky gold with heavily rising bubbles, thin whit head. Smell is very farmhouse, vineger, lemon and grass. Flavor is very vinegery.

The color is a tad bit cloudy with a thin off white head, and some minor spots along the sides of the glass. The nose is full of lemon grass with some floral hops and malt. Initially the flavor is amazing there is so much going on in your mouth. You can taste a lot of lemon and spice blended with tropical fruits. There is also a yeast like flavor that sticks to the sides of your mouth. Overall it has a great texture with a well balanced flavor and great amount of carbonation. Also impressed with choice of yeast since it really makes the beer what it is.

Pours an ultra cloudy gold, straw colour with an airy white head. The nose lends itself to nuances of tart tropical fruits, zesty, sweet orange, wheat and coriander. The flavour is beautifully tart, refreshing and sweet. The orange flavor comes across as authentic as it does in a Mimosa. The finish is zesty and lactic from the wheat. The impressions of tropical citrus are lively and full. There is also a slight barnyard funk accompanying the taste from start to finish. The mouthfeel is tingly, crisp and medium bodied. Great job Jolly Pumpkin! The best Wit Ive ever had.

Crystal clear coloured light amber colour with a bright orange glow. Thin white head tops the beer, but the colour speaks for itself. Aroma of wheat, yeast, curacao and a light fruity scent.
